gurmukhi: hvwie bMdgI Awvurd dr vjUd mrw
transliteration: havaae bandhagee aavuradh dhar vajoodh maraa
translation: The attraction of meditation and religious devotion brought me into this world,

gurmukhi: vgrnw zoik cunIN n bUd mrw ]1]1]
transliteration: vagaranaa zok chunee n boodh maraa | 1 | 1 |
translation: Otherwise, I had no urge to come. (1) (1)

gurmukhi: KuS Asq aumr ikh dr Xwd ibguzrd vrnw
transliteration: khush asath oumar kih dhar yaadh biguzaradh varanaa
translation: Only that part of my life is useful and happy that is spent in remembering the Akaalpurakh

gurmukhi: ic hwsl Asq AzIx guMbid kbUd mrw ]1]2]
transliteration: ch haasal asath azeen gunbadh kaboodh maraa | 1 | 2 |
translation: Otherwise what is the benefit to me from this blue sky or the world. (1) (2)

gurmukhi: drwN zmwN ik inAweI b-Xwd mI-mrm
transliteration: dharaa zamaa k niaaee ba-yaadh mee-marama
translation: For any moment that you are out of my remembrance, I feel that I am dying,

gurmukhi: bZYr Xwid qU zIN zIsqn ich sUd mrw ]1]3]
transliteration: baghair yaadh thoo zee zeesathan chih soodh maraa | 1 | 3 |
translation: What is the purpose of my life (it became worthless) without your reminiscence.(1) (3)

gurmukhi: i&dwsq jwno idil mn b-^wik mrdim pwk
transliteration: fidhaasath jaano dhil man ba-khaak maradham paaka
translation: I can sacrifice my heart and soul uninhibitedly for (the dust of the feet of) this holy person

gurmukhi: hr AwN ksy ikh bU-sUie qU rih nmUd mrw ]1]4]
transliteration: har aa kasae kih boo-sooe thoo rehi namoodh maraa | 1 | 4 |
translation: Who has shown me the way to You, the Akaalpurakh. (1) (4)

gurmukhi: nbUd hIc inSwn hw iz-Awsmwno zmIN
transliteration: naboodh heech nishaan haa zi-aasamaano zamee
translation: There was no sign-posts on the Pilgrim's way through earth or sky at that time,

gurmukhi: ik SOik rUie qU Awvurd dr sjUd mrw ]1]5]
transliteration: k shaauak rooe thoo aavuradh dhar sajoodh maraa | 1 | 5 |
translation: When my longing for Your glimpse made me prostrate in Your honor. (1) (5)

gurmukhi: bZYr Xwid qU goXw nmI qvwnm zIsq
transliteration: baghair yaadh thoo goyaa namee thavaanam zeesatha
translation: O Goya! I cannot live without Your remembrance, If pining for you ceases, then an end to life is the only thing coveted;

gurmukhi: bsUie dosq rhweI idhMd zUd mrw ]1]6]
transliteration: basooe dhosath rehaaee dhihandh zoodh maraa | 1 | 6 |
translation: I will be free then to move in the direction of my Beloved. (1) (6)

gurmukhi: dIno dunIAw dr kmMid AwN prI ru^swir mw
transliteration: dheeno dhuneeaa dhar kamandh aa paree rukhasaar maa
translation: Both the religion and the actions of the world are in the grip of my beloved, handsome and fairy-faced friend.

gurmukhi: hr do Awlm kImiq X?k qwir mUie Xwir mw ]2]1]
transliteration: har dho aalam keemath yak thaar mooe yaar maa | 2 | 1 |
translation: Both the worlds, this and the next, are (not) equal to or match the price (weight) of just one hair of my friend-mentor, Guru Gobind Singh Ji. (2) (1)

gurmukhi: mw nmI Awrym qwib Zmzwie imzgwin aU
transliteration: maa namee aaraem thaab ghamazaae mizagaan oo
translation: I don't have the strength to bear the intensity of even one of his skewed looks,

gurmukhi: X?k ingwih jwN-iPzwieS bs bvd drkwir mw ]2]2]
transliteration: yak nigaahi jaa-fizaaeish bas bavadh dharakaar maa | 2 | 2 |
translation: Just one of his (blessed) looks, that prolongs life instantly, is enough for me. (2) (2)

gurmukhi: gwhy sUPI gwhy zwihd gih klMdr mI Svd
transliteration: gaahae soofee gaahae zaahidh gehi kalandhar mee shavadha
translation: Sometimes, he acts like a mystic, sometimes like a meditator, and other times like a carefree recluse;

gurmukhi: rMghwie mu^qilP dwrd buiq AXwr mw ]2]3]
transliteration: rangehaae mukhathalif dhaaradh buth ayaar maa | 2 | 3 |
translation: He is our pilot steering our way; he operates in numerous different postures. (2) (3)

gurmukhi: kdir lwAil aU bjuz AwiSk nwN dwnd hIc ks
transliteration: kadhar laaal oo bajuz aashik naa dhaanadh heech kasa
translation: Who other than his true devotee-lover can evaluate his pearl-like lips?

gurmukhi: kImiq XwkUq dwnd cSim gOhr bwir mw ]2]4]
transliteration: keemath yaakooth dhaanadh chasham gaauehar baar maa | 2 | 4 |
translation: The value of this gem is only appreciated by a diamond-rearing-vision. (2) (4)

gurmukhi: hr nPs goXw b-Xwd nrgis m^mUir aU
transliteration: har nafas goyaa ba-yaadh naragas makhamoor oo
translation: During every moment of Goyaa's life, my alert heart and soul are relishing

gurmukhi: bwdwhwie SOk mI-noSd idil huiSAwir mw ]2]5]
transliteration: baadhaahaae shaauak mee-noshadh dhil hushiaar maa | 2 | 5 |
translation: the memory of intoxication of his Narcissus-like-imbued eyes. (2) (5)

gurmukhi: bidh swkI mrw X?k jwm zwN rMgInIie idlhw
transliteration: badhih saakee maraa yak jaam zaa rangeeneee dhilehaa
translation: O bartender! Kindly spare a heart-warming-shot out of your enjoyable intoxication for me also,

gurmukhi: bcSim pwk-bIx Awswx kunm eI jumlw muSikl hw ]3]1]
transliteration: bachasham paaka-been aasaan kunam ee jumalaa mushakil haa | 3 | 1 |
translation: so that with my eyes of recognizing the God-sent prophet, I can solve all my riddles. (3) (1)

gurmukhi: mrw dr mMizl jwnwN hmw AYSo hmw SwdI
transliteration: maraa dhar manzil jaanaa hamaa aisho hamaa shaadhee
translation: When moving towards the destination, my Beloved, I am ever in blissful elation.

gurmukhi: jrs byhUdw mI-nwld kujw bMdym mihml hw ]3]2]
transliteration: jaras baehoodhaa mee-naaladh kujaa bandhaem mehimal haa | 3 | 2 |
translation: The bell in the neck of a female camel is peeling for nothing. It cannot stop me from proceeding to my goal. (3) (2)

gurmukhi: ^udw hwizr bvd dwiem bbIN dIdwir pwikS rw
transliteration: khudhaa haazir bavadh dhaaeim babee dheedhaar paakish raa
translation: The Akaalpurakh is Omnipresent. Our strive to seek his glimpses should be spontaneous

gurmukhi: nw igrdwby drU hwiel nw dirAwE nw swihl hw ]3]3]
transliteration: naa giradhaabae dharoo haaeil naa dhariaaou naa saahil haa | 3 | 3 |
translation: Without any obstacle of the whirlpool, the torrent or the bank of the river. (3) (3)

gurmukhi: icrw byhUdw mIgrdI b-sihrw E b-dsq AY idl
transliteration: chiraa baehoodhaa meegaradhee ba-sehiraa ou ba-dhasath ai dhila
translation: Why are we wandering (aimlessly) in jungles and wildernesses,

gurmukhi: cUM AwN sulqwin KUbwN krdw AMdr dIdw mMizl hw ]3]4]
transliteration: choon aa sulathaan khoobaa karadhaa andhar dheedhaa manzil haa | 3 | 4 |
translation: When He, The Master of Beauty, has made his abode in our own eyes? (3) (4)

gurmukhi: cUM ZYr Az jwiq-pwikS nIsq dr hr jw ik mI-bInm
transliteration: choon ghair az jaathi-paakish neesath dhar har jaa k mee-beenama
translation: When I look around without the Akaalpurakh, I see only a big void;

gurmukhi: bgo goXw kujw ibguzwrm eIN duinAw E AYhil hw ]3]5]
transliteration: bago goyaa kujaa biguzaaram ee dhuniaa ou aihal haa | 3 | 5 |
translation: Then Goyaa, you tell me, with whom can I entrust this world and my family and household affairs? (3) (5)

gurmukhi: ibAw AY swkIey rMgIn iz mY pur kun A?XwZ eINjw
transliteration: biaa ai saakeeeae rangeen z mai pur kun ayaagh eejaa
translation: O bartender! Please fill up my glass with a colored alcohol, cup of love,

gurmukhi: nSwie lwAl mY-gUnq iz h?k b^Sd surwg eIxjw ]4]1]
transliteration: nashaae laaal mai-goonath z hak bakhashadh suraag eenajaa | 4 | 1 |
translation: Because ruby-colored alcohol will give me clues towards my Master. (4) (1)

gurmukhi: Anl-h?k Az lib mnsUr gr cUM SISw kulkul krd
transliteration: anala-hak az lab manasoor gar choon sheeshaa kulakul karadha
translation: If the long-necked decanter, like the word, 'Analhaqq', coming out of Mansoor's lips, were to create the ripple sound,

gurmukhi: ikh Awrd qwib eIN shbw kujw jwim idmwg eINjw ]4]2]
transliteration: kih aaradh thaab ee sehabaa kujaa jaam dhimaag eejaa | 4 | 2 |
translation: Then, who will endure the strength of such a wee-hour alcohol? And where would there be a brain-cup (to receive such a powerful drink)? (4) (2)

gurmukhi: jhwx qwrIk Sud jwnwx br A&rUz eIx k?id rwAnw
transliteration: jehaan thaareek shudh jaanaan bar afarooz een kadh raaanaa
translation: There is darkness in the world. O beloved! Enhance your beauty by increased burnishing, and your moon-face be a candle to the way-farer.

gurmukhi: numw ru^swrwie qwbwx ik mI-bwied crwZ eIx jw ]4]3]
transliteration: numaa rukhasaaraae thaabaan k mee-baaeidh charaagh een jaa | 4 | 3 |
translation: And make your face conspicuously identifiable, because there is a need of a light (lamp) in this world. (4) (3)

gurmukhi: b?eIx X?k-dm ik Xwd Awied qvwN aumry bsr burdn
transliteration: baeen yaka-dham k yaadh aaeidh thavaa oumarae basar buradhana
translation: The whole life becomes worth living if we can grab a moment (ecstacy) in our Master's remembrance,

gurmukhi: Agr Xkdm ksy bwied bSOik h?k &rwg eINjw ]4]4]
transliteration: agar yakadham kasae baaeidh bashaauak hak faraag eejaa | 4 | 4 |
translation: Provided, one happens to have such a trice of eagerness, keenness and zest for Akaalpurakh's love. (4) (4)

gurmukhi: do cSim mn ik drXwie AzImu?Swx bvd goXw
transliteration: dho chasham man k dharayaae azeemushaan bavadh goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, Both of my eyes are like a long and large stream,

gurmukhi: iz hr ASkm bvd SwdwbIie sd bwZ bwZ eIxjw ]4]5]
transliteration: z har ashakam bavadh shaadhaabeee sadh baagh baagh eenajaa | 4 | 5 |
translation: And every tear coming out of them can bring greenery to hundreds of smiling gardens (because of my faith). (4) (5)

gurmukhi: rih-rswin rwih h?k Awmd Adb
transliteration: rehi-rasaan raahi hak aamadh adhaba
translation: It is essential for the travellers on the path towards the Creator to have His remembrance in their hearts,

gurmukhi: hm bidl Xwid ^udw v hm blb ]5]1]
transliteration: ham badhil yaadh khudhaa v ham balab | 5 | 1 |
translation: And additionally, should have meditation of His Naam on their lips. (5) (1)

gurmukhi: hr kujw dIdym Anvwir ^udw
transliteration: har kujaa dheedhaem anavaar khudhaa
translation: At every place, I observe the radiance and manifestation of the Providence

gurmukhi: bsik Az suhbiq bzurgwx Sud jzb ]5]2]
transliteration: basak az suhabath bazuragaan shudh jazab | 5 | 2 |
translation: When I get absorbed in the company of noble souls (which confers on me the blessing of realization). (5) (2)

gurmukhi: cSim-mw ZYr Az jmwlS vw nw Sud
transliteration: chashami-maa ghair az jamaalash vaa naa shudha
translation: Our (inside) eyes cannot be really opened without Akaalpurakh's elegance,

gurmukhi: zwx ik jumlw ^lk rw dIdym r?b ]5]3]
transliteration: zaan k jumalaa khalak raa dheedhaem rab | 5 | 3 |
translation: Because we perceive His presence in the entire humanity. (5) (3)

gurmukhi: ^wik kdmS rOSnIie ijl kund
transliteration: khaak kadhamash raauashaneee jil kunadha
translation: The dust of their feet (humility) can enlighten our hearts, provided,

gurmukhi: Zr qurwbw swilkwN bwSd nsb ]5]4]
transliteration: ghar thuraabaa saalikaa baashadh nasab | 5 | 4 |
translation: we can establish a sound relationship with those noble souls who are treading this path (of deep devotion for the Master). (5) (4)

gurmukhi: kIsq goXw ku mrwid idl n Xw&q
transliteration: keesath goyaa k maraadh dhil n yaafatha
translation: Bhai Sahib (Goyaa) is posing the question: Who is that person

gurmukhi: hr ksy bw nPis ^ud krdw jzb ]5]5]
transliteration: har kasae baa nafas khudh karadhaa jazab | 5 | 5 |
translation: whose inner desires have not been fulfilled after he can get over his ego? (5) (5)

gurmukhi: idl AZr dwnw bvd AMdr iknwrS Xwr hsq
transliteration: dhil aghar dhaanaa bavadh andhar kinaarash yaar hasatha
translation: If our mind and heart were intelligent, then the Beloved is in their embrace, and,

gurmukhi: cSm gr bInw bvd dr hr qr& dIdwr hsq ]6]1]
transliteration: chasham gar beenaa bavadh dhar har tharaf dheedhaar hasath | 6 | 1 |
translation: if our eyes were able to appreciate all that they see, then, they will see glimpses and glimpses (of the Beloved) all over. (6) (1)

gurmukhi: hr qrP dIdwr A?mw dIdwie bInw kujw hsq
transliteration: har tharaf dheedhaar amaa dheedhaae beenaa kujaa hasatha
translation: There are glimpses and glimpses (of the Beloved) all over, but where is the eye to appreciate them?

gurmukhi: hr qrP qUr Asq hr sU SoAlwey Anvwr hsq ]6]2]
transliteration: har tharaf thoor asath har soo shoalaaeae anavaar hasath | 6 | 2 |
translation: There is the Mount Sinai all over, and there are leaping flames of His glow and refulgence. (6) (2)

gurmukhi: sr Agr dwrI ibrO sr rw ibinh br pwie aU
transliteration: sar agar dhaaree biraau sar raa binih bar paae oo
translation: If you have a head on your body, you should go to Him and place it on His lotus feet;

gurmukhi: jwx Agr dwrI inswirS kun Agr drkwr hsq ]6]3]
transliteration: jaan agar dhaaree nisaarish kun agar dharakaar hasath | 6 | 3 |
translation: And, if you have life in you which you value very much, then sacrifice it for Him. (6) (3)

gurmukhi: dsq Agr dwrI ibrO dwmwin jwnwx rw bgIr
transliteration: dhasath agar dhaaree biraau dhaamaan jaanaan raa bageera
translation: If you have a hand, then grab and hold tight the corner of His robe.

gurmukhi: sUey aUo mI rO Agr pw rw sir rPqwr hsq ]6]4]
transliteration: sooeae ooo mee raau agar paa raa sar rafathaar hasath | 6 | 4 |
translation: If your feet are anxious (or have the strength) to walk, then start walking fast towards Him. (6) (4)

gurmukhi: ZoS Agr Sunvw bvd jz nwim h?k ky ibSnvd
transliteration: ghosh agar shunavaa bavadh jaz naam hak kae bishanavadha
translation: If we have ears that have perfect hearing then they should not hear anything other than the Naam of Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: vr zubwx goXw bvd dr hr s^un Asrwr hsq ]6]5]
transliteration: var zubaan goyaa bavadh dhar har sakhun asaraar hasath | 6 | 5 |
translation: If our tongue has the power to speak, then it should utter mystic expressions. (6) (5)

gurmukhi: by-Adb pw rw minh mnsUr vS dr rwih ieSk
transliteration: bae-adhab paa raa manih manasoor vash dhar raahi eishaka
translation: A Brahmin is a devotee of his idol and a Muslim of his shrine;

gurmukhi: rwh riv eIx rwh rw Av?l kdm br dwr hsq ]6]6]
transliteration: raah rav een raah raa aval kadham bar dhaar hasath | 6 | 6 |
translation: I am enamored wherever I find an adorer-connoisseur of 'devotion'. (6) (6)

gurmukhi: bRhmn muSqwik bu?q zwihd i&dwie ^wnkwh
transliteration: brehaman mushathaak buth zaahidh fidhaae khaanakaaha
translation: Like Mansorr, do not step on the path of devotion with arrogance,

gurmukhi: hr kujw jwim muh?bq dIdwAm srSwr hsq ]6]7]
transliteration: har kujaa jaam muhabath dheedhaaam sarashaar hasath | 6 | 7 |
translation: Otherwise, it is a path where there is a crucifix at the very first step.(6) (7)

gurmukhi: hr ic dwrI dr bjwiq ^ud inswir Xwr kun
transliteration: har ch dhaaree dhar bajaath khudh nisaar yaar kuna
translation: Goya says, If your disposition is similar to mine of getting mollified by diamonds,

gurmukhi: gr qurw mwinMid goXw, qbwAwie gohr bwr hsq ]6]8]
transliteration: gar thuraa maanindh goyaa, thabaaaae gohar baar hasath | 6 | 8 |
translation: Even then, you should willingly sacrifice all your assets for your Beloved. (6) (8)

gurmukhi: gdwie kUie qurw mYil bwdSwhI nIsq
transliteration: gadhaae kooe thuraa mail baadhashaahee neesatha
translation: Goyaa, the beggar and mendicant in your street, has absolutely no desire for an imperial kingdom,

gurmukhi: hvwie slqnqo zoik kjkulwhI nIsq ]7]1]
transliteration: havaae salathanatho zok kajakulaahee neesath | 7 | 1 |
translation: He does have a desire for a realm but not only for the sake of a royal tilted cap of power (which brings in ego). (7) (1)

gurmukhi: hr Awx ik mmlkiq idl igRPq sulqwx Sud
transliteration: har aan k mamalakath dhil grifath sulathaan shudha
translation: Whosoever has won over the realm of 'mind', he is considered as the all-powerful monarch,

gurmukhi: ksy ik Xw&q qurw hmcU E ispwhI nIsq ]7]2]
transliteration: kasae k yaafath thuraa hamachoo ou sipaahee neesath | 7 | 2 |
translation: And, whosoever has discovered You does not have a rival as a soldier. (7) (2)

gurmukhi: gdwie kUie qurw bwdSwih hr do srw-sq
transliteration: gadhaae kooe thuraa baadhashaahi har dho saraa-satha
translation: (Addressing Dasam Guru) An established beggar in your street is the emperor of both the worlds,

gurmukhi: AsIir ^iq qurw hwjiq gvwhI nIsq ]7]3]
transliteration: aseer khath thuraa haajath gavaahee neesath | 7 | 3 |
translation: The captive of the ecstasy of the love of your burgeoning hair is not just looking for resurrection. (7) (3)

gurmukhi: kudwm dIdw ik dr vY svwid nUir qU nIsq
transliteration: kudhaam dheedhaa k dhar vai savaadh noor thoo neesatha
translation: Which is that eye that does not have the glow of Your glory?

gurmukhi: kudwm sInw ik aU m^zin ielwhI nIsq ]7]4]
transliteration: kudhaam seenaa k oo makhazan eilaahee neesath | 7 | 4 |
translation: Which is that body (chest) that doesn't have godly treasures in it? (7) (4)

gurmukhi: i&dwie aU SO v aujry mKwh AY goXw
transliteration: fidhaae oo shaau v oujarae makhaah ai goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, Do not hesitate or make excuses but sacrifice yourself for Him,

gurmukhi: ik dr qrIkiq-mwjwie auzr ^whI nIsq ]7]5]
transliteration: k dhar thareekathi-maajaae ouzar khaahee neesath | 7 | 5 |
translation: Because in the vocabulary of lovers (of true devotees), there is no word like 'excuse'. (7) (5)

gurmukhi: Az pyiS cSm AwN buiq nwN-imhrbwN guzSq
transliteration: az paesh chasham aa buth naa-miharabaa guzashatha
translation: A non-compassionate cruel beloved passed through before my eyes;

gurmukhi: jwnwN guzSq qw ic rhy dIdw jwN guzSq ]8]1]
transliteration: jaanaa guzashath thaa ch rehae dheedhaa jaa guzashath | 8 | 1 |
translation: As the beloved went through, it was as if my life (heart and soul) passed away through my eyes. (8) (1)

gurmukhi: rogS kbUd v idlS pur Srwrw sw^q
transliteration: rogash kaboodh v dhilash pur sharaaraa saakhatha
translation: The smoke from my continued sighs rose high and deep through the sky,

gurmukhi: Az bsik dUid Awih mn Az AwsmwN guzSq ]8]2]
transliteration: az basak dhoodh aahi man az aasamaa guzashath | 8 | 2 |
translation: That they changed its very complexion into teal-blue color and charred its heart. (8) (2)

gurmukhi: mw rw b-X?k ieSwrwie AbrU ShId krd
transliteration: maa raa ba-yak eishaaraae abaroo sheheedh karadha
translation: With one pointer with his eyebrows, he simply (metaphorically) murdered (martyred) us,

gurmukhi: AknUM ielwj nIsq ik qIr Az kmwN guzSq ]8]3]
transliteration: akanoon eilaaj neesath k theer az kamaa guzashath | 8 | 3 |
translation: But there is no treatment now when the arrow has been shot from the bow. (8) (3)

gurmukhi: X?k dm b-KoS rwh nw burdm ik kIsqm
transliteration: yak dham ba-khosh raah naa buradham k keesathama
translation: Goyaa says, I cannot attain nor understand my reality as to who I am,

gurmukhi: AY vwie nkd izMdgIAm rwiegwx guzSq ]8]4]
transliteration: ai vaae nakadh zindhageeam raaeigaan guzashath | 8 | 4 |
translation: Alas ! I have simply wasted all my life's assets.? (8) (4)

gurmukhi: hrigz b-sYir rOzwie irzvwx nmI rvd
transliteration: haragiz ba-sair raauazaae rizavaan namee ravadha
translation: Goyaa says, If someone ever happens to pass through the street of the Beloved,

gurmukhi: goXw ksy ik jwinb kuie buqwx guzSq ]8]5]
transliteration: goyaa kasae k jaanib kue buthaan guzashath | 8 | 5 |
translation: He would then never go for a stroll (which will be beneath the above pleasure) even in the heavenly garden.? (8) (5)

gurmukhi: bdr pyiS rUie qU SrimMdw Asq
transliteration: badhar paesh rooe thoo sharamindhaa asatha
translation: The moon is abashed when compared to your (beautiful) face,

gurmukhi: blik ^urSIid jhwx hm bMdw Asq ]9]1]
transliteration: balak khurasheedh jehaan ham bandhaa asath | 9 | 1 |
translation: In fact, even the world's sun is also mortified before your radiance, O Guru! its glow and light is subservient to yours. (9) (1)

gurmukhi: cSim mw hrigz bgYr Az h?k nw dId
transliteration: chasham maa haragiz bagair az hak naa dheedha
translation: Goyaa: My eyes have never recognized anyone other than the Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: AY ^uSw cSmy ik bIinMdw Asq ]9]2]
transliteration: ai khushaa chashamae k beenindhaa asath | 9 | 2 |
translation: Blessed are the eyes which can possibly see the Almighty.? (9) (2)

gurmukhi: mw nmI lw&ym Az zuhdo irAw
transliteration: maa namee laafaem az zuhadho riaa
translation: I do not brag about my meditation or sanctimony,

gurmukhi: gr gunwh Zwrym h?k b^iSMdw Asq ]9]3]
transliteration: gar gunaah ghaaraem hak bakhashindhaa asath | 9 | 3 |
translation: But if I am ever guilty of this sin, the Waaheguru is all-Forgiving.? (9) (3)

gurmukhi: dIgry rw Az kujw Awrym mw
transliteration: dheegarae raa az kujaa aaraem maa

transliteration: sunbalae zulaf thoo dhil raa buradh asatha
translation: The scented locks of your hair have captivated my mind and soul,

gurmukhi: Awx lib lwAil qU jwx bwSd lzIz ]34]4]
transliteration: aan lab laaal thoo jaan baashadh lazeez | 34 | 4 |
translation: And it is hanging near your ruby red lips. It is so sensuous and relishable. (34) (4)

gurmukhi: l?ziq goXw nih bwSd ibh Azwx
transliteration: lazath goyaa nehi baashadh bih azaana
translation: O Goyaa! There is no other larger pleasure or sweeter,

gurmukhi: hmcU iSAry qU b-ihMdusqwx lzIz ]34]5]
transliteration: hamachoo shiarae thoo ba-hindhusathaan lazeez | 34 | 5 |
translation: What the people of India derive singing your poetry. (34) (5)

gurmukhi: Awir&wx rw sUie aU bwSd lzIz
transliteration: aarifaan raa sooe oo baashadh lazeeza
translation: For the spiritually enlightened persons, only His posture is joyful,

gurmukhi: AwiSkwx rw kUey aU bwSd lzIz ]35]1]
transliteration: aashikaan raa kooeae oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 1 |
translation: And for the lovers, the streets of their beloved are the way to happiness. (35) (1)

gurmukhi: kwkil aU idl &ryib Awlm Asq
transliteration: kaakal oo dhil faraeb aalam asatha

gurmukhi: qwilbwx rw mUey aU bwSd lzIz ]35]2]
transliteration: thaalibaan raa mooeae oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 2 |

gurmukhi: rOzwie bwiZ ierm kurbwx kunm

translation: I love his (Guru's) street so much that

gurmukhi: bsik mw rw kUie aU bwSd lzIz ]35]3]
transliteration: basak maa raa kooe oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 3 |
translation: I will swap it anytime and sacrifice even the garden of heaven for it. (35) (3)

gurmukhi: izMdw mI grdm iz bUie mkdmS
transliteration: zindhaa mee garadham z booe makadhamasha
translation: I get completely revived with the aroma of his holy feet, blessed arrival,

gurmukhi: bsik mw rw bUie bwSd lzIz ]35]4]
transliteration: basak maa raa booe baashadh lazeez | 35 | 4 |
translation: That is why I relish that fragrance so much. (35) (4)

gurmukhi: izkir Xwid h?k ik aU bwSd lzIz
transliteration: zikar yaadh hak k oo baashadh lazeeza
translation: How tasteful and savoray is even the talk of the thought and remembrance of Akaalpurakh?

gurmukhi: Az hmw myvw ik aU bwSd lzIz ]35]5]
transliteration: az hamaa maevaa k oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 5 |

gurmukhi: Awb-b^SI jumlw Awlm my SvI
transliteration: aaba-bakhashee jumalaa aalam mae shavee
translation: If you aspire the pursuit for this kind of ambition,

gurmukhi: gr qurw eIx AwrzU bwSd lzIz ]35]6]
transliteration: gar thuraa een aarazoo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 6 |
translation: Then, you would be the one who would bestow the divine nectar to the whole world. (35) (6)

gurmukhi: SyAir goXw byS Az SIro Skr
transliteration: shaear goyaa baesh az sheero shakara
translation: The poetry of Goyaa is such a fruit in India

gurmukhi: myvw dr ihMdusqwx bwSd lzIz ]35]7]
transliteration: maevaa dhar hindhusathaan baashadh lazeez | 35 | 7 |
translation: That it is proclaimed as far sweeter than even sugar and milk. (35) (7)

gurmukhi: z &Yiz mkdmq AY AbrUie &sil bhwr
transliteration: z faiz makadhamath ai abarooe fasal behaara
translation: O eyebrows (sprouts) of the crop of spring season! With the grace of your advent,

gurmukhi: jhwx cU bwiZ ierm pur Sudsq Az Zulzwr ]36]1]
transliteration: jehaan choo baagh eiram pur shudhasath az ghulazaar | 36 | 1 |
translation: The entire world is filled with flowers like the garden of heavens. (36) (1)

gurmukhi: qb?sim qU jhwx rw h?Xwq mI b^Sd
transliteration: thabasam thoo jehaan raa hayaath mee bakhashadha
translation: O Guru! Your beautiful smile bestows and instills life to the world,

gurmukhi: krwr dIdwie swihb-idlwx pur-iesrwr ]36]2]
transliteration: karaar dheedhaae saahiba-dhilaan pura-eisaraar | 36 | 2 |

gurmukhi: bZYr ieSik ^udw hIc ieSk kwiem nIsq

translation: There is no ever-lasting love or devotion other than the love of Waaheguru,

transliteration: baghair aashik maaualaa hamaa fanaah pindhaar | 36 | 3 |

gurmukhi: bhr qr& ik ingwhy kunI rvwx b^SI

translation: In whichever direction you look, you bestow and instil new life and spirit,

gurmukhi: ingwih qusq ik dr hr qr& bvd jwxbwr ]36]4]
transliteration: nigaahi thusath k dhar har tharaf bavadh jaanabaar | 36 | 4 |
translation: It is your vision only that blesses showers of new life everywhere. (36) (4)

gurmukhi: ^udw ik dr hmw hwlsq hwzro nwizr
transliteration: khudhaa k dhar hamaa haalasath haazaro naazira
translation: Akaalpurakh is omnipresent at every place under all circumstances and with everyone all the times,

transliteration: kujaasath dheedhaa k beenadh behar tharaf dheedhaar | 36 | 5 |

gurmukhi: bZYr Awri& mOlw ksy njwq n-Xw&q

translation: No one other than those dedicated to the love of God has ever been redeemed.

gurmukhi: Azl zmIno zmwN rw igR&qw dr imnkwr ]36]6]
transliteration: azal zameeno zamaa raa grifathaa dhar minakaar | 36 | 6 |
translation: The 'death' has captured both the 'earth' and the 'time' with its sharp beak. (36) (6)

gurmukhi: hmySw izMdw bvd bMdwie ^udw goXw

translation: Goyaa says, A devotee of Akaalpurakh becomes immortal,

gurmukhi: ik ZYr bMdgIAS nIsq dr Ahwx Awswr ]36]7]
transliteration: k ghair bandhageeash neesath dhar ahaan aasaar | 36 | 7 |
translation: Because, without his meditation, no one else will ever leave a sign behind in this world. (36) (7)

gurmukhi: mn Az jvwx ik pIr Sudm dr iknwir aumr

translation: I became old from young in the lap of the 'age',

gurmukhi: AY bw-qo ^uS guzSq mrw dr iknwir aumr ]37]1]
transliteration: ai baa-tho khush guzashath maraa dhar kinaar oumar | 37 | 1 |

translation: Consider the remaining breaths of your life as blessed,

transliteration: aakhir khizaan bar aavuradh een naau behaar oumar | 37 | 2 |
translation: Because, it will be the autumn (old age) that will bring the spring (season of youth) of your life one day. (37) (2)

gurmukhi: hwx mugqnm Sumwr dmy rw b-izkir h?k

gurmukhi: bwSd rvwx cU kw&lwie mOj pY b pY

gurmukhi: sd kwr krdweI ik nXwied bkwir qU

transliteration: goyaa bikun k baaz biaaeidh bakaar oumar | 37 | 5 |
translation: Therefore, engage yourself in such activities that will be useful again and hereafter (37) (5)

gurmukhi: mw ik dIdym sir kUie qU AY mihrim rwz

translation: O Knower of all mysteries! We, who have seen the higher end of Your street,

transliteration: vaz hamaa rooe fagandhaem sar khudh niaaz | 38 | 1 |

gurmukhi: qw bgrdy sir kUie qU bgrdId Awm

translation: Since I made my visits to your street as a commonplace,

transliteration: rozaae khuladhee bareen raa bikunam paa andhaaz | 38 | 2 |

translation: Your face's sight is that sacred text that protects everyone under all circumstances.

gurmukhi: idil mn by qU cUnwsq ich goiedw goXw

translation: O Guru! The whole world is bewildered and is confused without you,

gurmukhi: sInw Az ihjir qU ibrXwxsqo bs ]39]1]
transliteration: seenaa az hijar thoo birayaanasatho bas | 39 | 1 |

transliteration: bar zabaanash naam subehaan asatho bas | 39 | 2 |

gurmukhi: Kwil muSkInS idil Awlm rbUd
transliteration: khaal mushakeenash dhil aalam raboodha
translation: The fragrant black speckle, the mole, of your cheek, has enamored the entire world,

translation: My heart and soul is simply captivated for his handsome stature and gait,

translation: Alas! I wish you had asked Goyaa even for a moment, How are you?

translation: Because, this is the only remedy for my painfully tortured heart. (39) (6)

gurmukhi: mudwm bwdw-kSo sUPI E s&w mI bwS

translation: After getting drunk (with His Naam), one should become pious and chaste,

translation: One should be inebriated and become indifferent to life and an embodiment of meditation.? (40) (1)

gurmukhi: bsUie ZYr imA&gn nzr ik by-bsrI

translation: You should not cast your eyes just even to look towards any one else; this will be an act of blindness;

transliteration: thamaam chasham shaau v sooe dhosath vaa mee baash | 40 | 2 |

gurmukhi: b-igrid kwmiq Awx Swih idlrubw mI grd

transliteration: n goeimath k sooe dhair yaa haram mee raaua
translation: I am not asking anyone to go to the temple or the Muslin shrine.

gurmukhi: bhr qr& ik rvI jwinib ^udw mI bwS ]40]4]
transliteration: behar tharaf k ravee jaanib khudhaa mee baash | 40 | 4 |

gurmukhi: bsUie ZYr cU byZwngwx ich mI grdI

translation: Turning away from me like a stranger, why are you are paying attention to my rivals?

gurmukhi: hmI iz hwil idil ^sqw AwSnw mI bwS ]40]5]
transliteration: hamee z haal dhil khasathaa aashanaa mee baash | 40 | 5 |

gurmukhi: mudwm Swikro Swdwb cUM idil goXw

translation: Goya says, Become content and pleasant like my heart, And do not become indifferent after having your desires fulfilled.

transliteration: thamaam muthalibo faarigh z mudhaaa mee baash | 40 | 6 |
translation: In fact, rid yourself of all purpose and pursuits.(This way, one can attain the real goal) (40) (6)

gurmukhi: hmw rw sInw ibrIAwnsqo ibrIAwnsqo ibrIAwnS

translation: Hearts of everyone in deep love are scorched and charred,

transliteration: dho aalam behir aan dheedhaar hairaanasatho hairaanash | 41 | 1 |
translation: Both the worlds are amazed and even desperately restless for his glimpse. (41) (1)

transliteration: namee baashadh eilaajae bih baraae chasham gireeaanash | 41 | 2 |
translation: And for the tearful eyes, there is no other better cure than this. (41) (2)

gurmukhi: mho ^urSId igrid kUie aU grdMd rUjO Sb

translation: Both the moon and the sun keep circling around His (God/Guru) abode night and day,

transliteration: ajaaeib raauashanee bakhash dho-aalam hasath ahisaanash | 41 | 3 |
translation: It is His blessing that He has bestowed them the capability of providing light to both the worlds. (41) (3)

gurmukhi: b-hr sUie ik mI bInm jmwlS jlvwgr bwSd

translation: Wherever I see, I find His comeliness and splendor all over.

gurmukhi: jhwx AwSu&qw E SYdw mdwm Az zuliP pihcwnS ]41]4]

translation: The whole world is anxious and daft because of His curly lock of hair. (41) (4)

gurmukhi: Sudw jyib zmIx pur lUlUie lwlw iz ASik mn
transliteration: shudhaa jaeb zameen pur loolooe laalaa z ashak mana
translation: Goyaa says, The pockets of the earth are filled with the pearls like tears from my eyes.

gurmukhi: jhwx ibigR&qw Am goXw b Xwid lwAil ^Mdwnk ]41]5]
transliteration: jehaan bigrifathaa am goyaa b yaadh laaal khandhaanak | 41 | 5 |
translation: I have captured the whole world when I remembered the smile from his red lips. (41) (5)

gurmukhi: hr ks SnIdw Asq iz qU Zu&qgUie ^ws
transliteration: har kas shaneedhaa asath z thoo ghufathagooe khaasa
translation: Anyone who has listened to Guru's enchanted words during his blessed  company,

transliteration: az sadh gham shadheedh shudhaa zoodh thar khalaas | 42 | 1 |
translation: Gets redeemed from hundreds of dire sorrows just in moments. (42) (1)

gurmukhi: Awib hX?wiq mw s^uin pIir kwiml Asq

translation: The word of a complete and perfect Guru is like a nectar-talisman for all of us.

gurmukhi: idlhwie murdw rw ibkund izMdw E ^lws ]42]2]

translation: It can revive and give salvation to demoralized and half dead minds.(42) (2)

gurmukhi: Az ^ud-nmweIey qU ^udw hsq dUr qr
transliteration: az khudha-namaaeeeae thoo khudhaa hasath dhoor thara
translation: God Almighty is miles farther away from the deception of our ego,

gurmukhi: bInI drUin ^yS SvI Az ^udI ^lws ]42]3]
transliteration: beenee dharoon khaesh shavee az khudhee khalaas | 42 | 3 |
translation: If we were to do some introspection, we can get rid of this vanity. (42) (3)

gurmukhi: cUM swlkwin ^udwie rw bw kunI qU i^dmqy
transliteration: choon saalakaan khudhaae raa baa kunee thoo khidhamathae
translation: If you do service to the holy and noble souls,

gurmukhi: Az kYid Zim jhW, b-Svd jwin qo ^lws ]42]4]
transliteration: az kaidh gham jehaa(n), ba-shavadh jaan tho khalaas | 42 | 4 |
translation: You, then, can get rid of  all worldly agonies and sorrows. (42) (4)

gurmukhi: goXw qU dsiq ^udw rw Az ihrs koqwh kun
transliteration: goyaa thoo dhasath khudhaa raa az hiras kothaah kuna
translation: O Goyaa! You must withdraw your hands from desire and greed,

gurmukhi: qw AMdrUin ^wnw bInI ^udwie ^ws ]42]5]
transliteration: thaa andharoon khaanaa beenee khudhaae khaas | 42 | 5 |
translation: So that you could realize the eclat of Almighty all within yourself. (42) (5)

gurmukhi: ibAw cU sriv ^rwmwx dmy b-sYir irAwz
transliteration: biaa choo sarav kharaamaan dhamae ba-sair riaaza
translation: Like the carefree pace of cypress tree, if you, the Guru, could visit the garden even for a moment,

gurmukhi: sUie qU dIdwie mw-rw ingwh gSq ibAwj ]43]1]
transliteration: sooe thoo dheedhaae maa-raa nigaah gashath biaaj | 43 | 1 |
translation: My eyes (of my soul) have completely exhausted themselves waiting for this  for your arrival. (43) (1)

gurmukhi: brwie ryiS idlm ^Mdwie qU mrhm bs
transliteration: baraae raesh dhilam khandhaae thoo mareham basa
translation: Just one smile of yours works as the unguent for my wounded (broken)  heart,

gurmukhi: qb?suim lib lwAlq dvwey hr iemrwz ]43]2]
transliteration: thabasum lab laaalath dhavaaeae har eimaraaz | 43 | 2 |
translation: And the smile from your ruby red lips is the cure of all of my ills. (43) (2)

gurmukhi: ingwh krd vw mqwie idlm b-Zwrq burd

transliteration: bureedh jaeb dhilam raa b ghamazaa choon mikaraaz | 43 | 3 |

gurmukhi: iz &Yiz mkdmq AY nO-bhwir gulSin husn

gurmukhi: icrw bhwliq goXw nzr nmI i&gnI

translation: Because, for the needy and indigent people, your one look fulfills all their desires and wishes. (43) (5)

translation: I have spread my blossoming heart and wide-open eyes as a carpet

gurmukhi: dwiemw idl rw bsUie h?k ibAwr

translation: How nice it would be if your Cyprus-like tall and slim stature

translation: Wherever the people have lit a lamp,

gurmukhi: Az SuAwie prqiv dIdwir pwk

translation: From the radiant rays of Your chaste glimpse,

gurmukhi: rbUd mkdim vslS iz mn ienwin i&rwk

translation: Thousands of devotees, having risked their lives, are standing and

translation: The kings abrogated their entire empires, So that

gurmukhi: AY ^wik drgih qU S&w-b^iS Awlm Asq

translation: Your heavenly dust blesses the suffering world with healthiness, kindly

translation: Your marvels and feats of skill are perfect, in fact perfection of perfections,

gurmukhi: AY jmwil qo As jmwlsqo jmwlsqo jmwl ]52]1]
transliteration: ai jamaal tho as jamaalasatho jamaalasatho jamaal | 52 | 1 |

translation: My vein of breath is nearest to your ire; this completely surprises my doctor.

gurmukhi: Xwir mw eIN icAW i^Awlsqo i^Awlsqo i^Awl ]52]2]
transliteration: yaar maa ee chiaaa(n) khiaalasatho khiaalasatho khiaal | 52 | 2 |
translation: Still, what thoughts we nurture about our self, O what thoughts we cherish! (52) (2)

gurmukhi: mn ndwnm ik kudwmm ik kudwmm ik kudwmm

gurmukhi: bMdwie-aU eym vwaU hwi&iz mn dr rmw hwl ]52]3]
transliteration: bandhaaei-oo eaem vaaoo haafiz man dhar ramaa haal | 52 | 3 |
translation: I only know that I am the slave (creation) and prot?g? of the Almighty and that it is Him only who is my protector everywhere.? (52) (3)

gurmukhi: idil mn &wrZ, v dr kUey qo, prvwz kund,
transliteration: dhil man faaragha, v dhar kooeae tho, paravaaz kunadha,a
translation: My heart and soul while snapping all its bondages flies to your street,

gurmukhi: gr iz rwih krim ^yS, b-b^SI pro bwl ]52]4]
transliteration: gar z raahi karam khaesha, ba-bakhashee paro baal | 52 | 4 |
translation: It is your blessing that makes my wings to spread for this flight. (52) (4)

gurmukhi: swihib hwl bjuz hri& ^udw dm n-znd

transliteration: ghair zikarash hamaa aavaaz bavadh keelo makaal | 52 | 5 |
translation: For them, any thing other than His meditation is just a farce and a meaningless  debate. (52) (5)

gurmukhi: murSid kwimil mw bMdgIAq &rmwiedw
transliteration: murashadh kaamil maa bandhageeath faramaaeidhaa
translation: My perfect Guru directs everyone to meditate the kaalpurakh,

transliteration: ai zehae kaal mubaarik k kunadh saahib haal | 52 | 6 |

gurmukhi: hr ik: goied qO ic: bwSI, v ic: goied juiz qo,
transliteration: har ki: goeidh thaau chi: baashee, v chi: goeidh juz tho,a

transliteration: gashath hairaa(n) hamaa aalam hamaa dhar ain jamaal | 52 | 7 |

gurmukhi: cUM ^udw hwizr Asq dr hmw hwl

translation: When Waaheguru is Omnipresent to shield us in all predicaments,

gurmukhi: qU icrw mI znI idgr pro bwl ]53]1]

translation: Why are you then wasting your time in making other (useless) efforts? (53) (1)

gurmukhi: hmid h?k go idgr mgo AY jwx

translation: You should praise the Lord, O my heart and soul! Do not utter any other word,

transliteration: saahib kaal baash v bandhaae haal | 53 | 2 |

gurmukhi: ZYr Xwid ^udw dmy ik guzSq

translation: A moment spent in an  activity except in the remembrance of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: mw isvw nIsq hr kujw bInI

translation: Wherever you see, there is nothing but Him,

gurmukhi: ZYr hri& ^udw mgo goXw

transliteration: k dhigar pooch hasath keelo kaal | 53 | 5 |

translation: My eyelids do not need any type of collyrium for existence,

gurmukhi: hr n&s sr br zmIx dwrym Az bihry sjUd

translation: We prostrate our head on the ground in prayers every moment and breath,

gurmukhi: bwdSwhwx rw &kIrwx bwdSwhI dwdw AMd

translation: God's holy men, the saints, have bestowed the kingdoms to the worldly kings,

gurmukhi: drUM mrdmuik dIdw idlrubw dIdm

translation: I have circumambulated both the places, the Kaabaa and the temple,

gurmukhi: gdweI krdin kUie qU ibh iz sulqwnIsq

translation: (The elation of) Begging in Your street, O Guru, is far better than any kingdom,

gurmukhi: mrw iz rUiz Azl Awmd eIx indw goXw

gurmukhi: Az dosq ZYir dosq qm?nw nmI kunym

gurmukhi: bw Xwr hmdmym n bInym ZYr aU

transliteration: maa chasham khudh barooe kasae vaa namee kunaem | 56 | 4 |

gurmukhi: prvwnw-vwr iZrid rui^ SmAw jwx idhym

transliteration: thaan een sarasath az sari-khudh vaa namee kunaem | 56 | 6 |

gurmukhi: mw bw-Xwid h?k hmySw izMdw-eym

gurmukhi: ^ud-nmw rw bMdgI mnzUr nIsq

translation: A self centered egoist does not accept nor believe in meditation,

translation: These earthen dolls, human beings, have been made sacred only because of Him, since His own image abides in all of them,

transliteration: maa khudhaae paak raa beenindhaa-eaem | 57 | 3 |

gurmukhi: mw bpwie Swh sr A&gMdw-eym

translation: I have placed my head at the lotus feet of my great King Master,

transliteration: az dho aalam dhasath raa afashaanadhaa-eaem | 57 | 4 |
translation: And, I have washed my hands off from both the worlds, this and the next. (57) (4)

gurmukhi: nIsq dr hr cSm ZYr Az nUir aU

translation: There is nothing else except his refulgence in everyone's eye,

gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k joieMdw-eym ]57]5]
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak joeindhaa-eaem | 57 | 5 |
translation: That is why, I have always sought the company of saintly persons. (57) (5)

transliteration: thaa badhaaman dhasath khudh afagandhaa eaem | 57 | 6 |

gurmukhi: kIsq goXw zwkir nwim ^udw

translation: Goyaa asks, Who is Goyaa?  meditator of the Naam of kaalpurakh,

transliteration: hamachoo khurasheedh jehaan rakhashandhaa eaem | 57 | 7 |
translation: That is the reason that he is shining in this world like the sun. (57) (7)

transliteration: dhushanaam n dhaanaem dhuaa raa naa-shanaasaem  | 58 | 1 |

gurmukhi: cUM gYir qU ks nIsq bqihkIk drIxzw

transliteration: een thafarakaae maa ou shumaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 3 |

transliteration: goeim v laekan saro paa raa na-shanaasaem | 58 | 4 |

gurmukhi: mw nIz cU goXw iz Azl msq eIsqm

transliteration: een kaaeidhaae zuhadho riaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 5 |

gurmukhi: hr gwh nzr bjwinib idldwr mI kunym

gurmukhi: hr jw ik dIdweym rui^ Xwr dIdweym

gurmukhi: mw juz hdIis rUie qU kUqy nw ^urdweym

translation: Goyaa says, I have never taken any other food stimulent  except the discourse about Your lovely face,

translation: While treading the path of love and affection, this has been enough, and I have been persistently asserting this. (59) (4)

gurmukhi: goXw iz cSim Xwr ik m^mUr gSqweym

translation: Goyaa says, I am inebriated with the intoxicating looks of my Beloved,

transliteration: kai khaahash sharaab pur asaraar mee kunaem | 59 | 5 |

translation: His tall and well-built God-given stature has become comely to my eyes. (60) (1)

gurmukhi: qmwmI murdwhw rw Az qb?sum izMdw mI swzd

translation: Goyaa says, He, the Guru, revives dead bodies into life with his smile,

gurmukhi: cU ryzd Awb hYvwx Az dhwin guMcw-^Mid-mn ]60]2]

translation: When he showers elixir-like expressions from his blossoming close-lipped bud-like mouth. (60) (2)

gurmukhi: brwie dIdin qU dIdwAm Sud cSmwie kOSr

translation: My eyes have become a source of an eternal fountain longing to have your glimpse;

translation: Come my Beloved! My pitiable suffering sad life is willing to sacrifice itself for you. (60) (3)

translation: If you, my Guru, would ever care to look deep into my heart, you will not find anything other than you there;

gurmukhi: ik ZYr Az izkir qUM nbUd drUin bMd bMid mn ]60]4]
transliteration: k ghair az zikar thoon naboodh dharoon bandh bandh man | 60 | 4 |
translation: Because, there is not even a mention of anyone except you in each and every limb of my body and every drop of my blood. (60) (4)

gurmukhi: mnm X?k muSiq igl goXw drUnm nUir E lwmA
transliteration: manam yak mushath gil goyaa dharoonam noor ou laamaa
translation: Gayaa says, I am a just a fistful of dust, but my inner self is bright and satiated with the glow of eternal light of his rays,

gurmukhi: bZridS dwiemw grdd idil pur hoSmMid mn ]60]5]
transliteration: bagharadhish dhaaeimaa garadhadh dhil pur hoshamandh man | 60 | 5 |
translation: Therefore, my alert and sane mind always echoes that message. (60) (5)

gurmukhi: byv&w nIsq ksy gr qU v&wdwr SvI
transliteration: baevafaa neesath kasae gar thoo vafaadhaar shavee
translation: Goyaa says, If you become faithful, then no one would betray you,

gurmukhi: vkq Awnsq ik br vkq ^brdwr SvI ]61]1]
transliteration: vakath aanasath k bar vakath khabaradhaar shavee | 61 | 1 |
translation: The time has come that you should be alert of this truth on time. (61) (1)

gurmukhi: jwx Agr hsq isir kdim jwnwx kun
transliteration: jaan agar hasath sir kadham jaanaan kuna
translation: If you are alive, then offer your heart as a sacrifice for His lotus feet,

gurmukhi: idl b-idldwr ibidh zwik qU idldwr SvI ]61]2]
transliteration: dhil ba-dhiladhaar bidhih zaak thoo dhiladhaar shavee | 61 | 2 |
translation: Present your heart and mind to your Beloved, so that you, yourself, would become a beloved. (61) (2)

gurmukhi: mMizil ieSk drwz Asq b-pw nqvwx r&q
transliteration: manzil eishak dharaaz asath ba-paa nathavaan rafatha
translation: The journey of love and devotion is extremely long and arduous; it cannot be traversed by walking on foot,

gurmukhi: sr kdm swz ik qw dr rih Awx Xwr SvI ]61]3]
transliteration: sar kadham saaz k thaa dhar rehi aan yaar shavee | 61 | 3 |
translation: We should walk making our head as our feet, so that we can travel on the path towards our Beloved and the trek can be completed. (61) (3)

gurmukhi: gu&qgUie hmw ks dr ^oir iedrwik ^ud Asq
transliteration: gufathagooe hamaa kas dhar khor eidharaak khudh asatha
translation: The conversation of each one of us is based upon our perception and knowledge,

gurmukhi: lB &robMd ik qw mihrim Asrwr SvI ]61]4]
transliteration: labh farobandh k thaa mehiram asaraar shavee | 61 | 4 |
translation: But you should keep your lips sealed so that you can realize and appreciate the truth about His mysteries. (61) (4)

gurmukhi: mI &roSd idil dIvwnwie ^ud rw goXw
transliteration: mee faroshadh dhil dheevaanaae khudh raa goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, I am presenting my infatuated mind for sale on the hope that

gurmukhi: b-aumIid krim Awx ik ^rIdwr SvI ]61]5]
transliteration: ba-oumeedh karam aan k khareedhaar shavee | 61 | 5 |
translation: You, the Guru, with your benevolence, might become its purchaser. (61) (5)

gurmukhi: swkI mrw qo ju?rw-ie jW iesiqAwk dyh
transliteration: saakee maraa tho juraa-e jaa(n) eisathiaak dhaeha
translation: O bartender! Kindly put my beloved in the cup of life; the urge to survive,

gurmukhi: qw rUey qy bInm, dUrI &rwk dyh ]62]1]
transliteration: thaa rooeae thae beenama, dhooree faraak dhaeh | 62 | 1 |
translation: So that I may live to see my beloved's face when I am free from separation.  (62) (1)

gurmukhi: dr hr qr& bInm, cUM rui^ qurw mudwm
transliteration: dhar har tharaf beenama, choon rukh thuraa mudhaama
translation: I look for your glimpse in every direction, but in vain

gurmukhi: bw idl mrw ^lwsI, Az A&qrwk dyh ]62]2]
transliteration: baa dhil maraa khalaasee, az afatharaak dhaeh | 62 | 2 |
translation: O heart! Kindly release me from life so that I can surrender before separation sets in. (62) (2)

gurmukhi: cUM by qo hyc nysq cUM bInym b-hr kujwsq
transliteration: choon bae tho haech naesath choon beenaem ba-har kujaasatha
translation: Everything is futile and every place is void without you, this is so everywhere,

gurmukhi: qw dIdh E idil mrw, qo ieMq&wk dyh ]62]3]
transliteration: thaa dheedheh ou dhil maraa, tho einthafaak dhaeh | 62 | 3 |
translation: Grant me the unity for my worldly heart and eyes that I can see you. (62) (3)

gurmukhi: cUM sw& gSq AweInw-ie idl Az svwid Zm
transliteration: choon saaf gashath aaeenaa-e dhil az savaadh ghama
translation: Scrape off the dross of sorrow from the mirror of my heart,

gurmukhi: bw vsl ^ud-nmweI, irhweI iz bWk dyh ]62]4]
transliteration: baa vasal khudha-namaaee, rihaaee z baa(n)k dhaeh | 62 | 4 |
translation: So that I see only your reflection in it and with it, the terror of separation is ended (62) (4)

gurmukhi: goieAw b-hr kujw ik b-bInm jmwil qo
transliteration: goeiaa ba-har kujaa k ba-beenam jamaal tho
translation: Goyaa says, I should be able to see only you and your splendid colors,

gurmukhi: qw idil mrw ^lwsIey, Az drdnwk dyh ]62]5]
transliteration: thaa dhil maraa khalaaseeeae, az dharadhanaak dhaeh | 62 | 5 |
translation: I seek release from tis bondage and the pain of separation. (62 ) (5)

gurmukhi: byv&w nysq ksy, gr qU v&wdwr SvI
transliteration: baevafaa naesath kasae, gar thoo vafaadhaar shavee
translation: If you believe in yourself, then no one shall be a non-believer or faithless,

gurmukhi: vkq AWsU ik: br vkq, ^brdwr SvI ]63]1]
transliteration: vakath aaa(n)soo ki: bar vakatha, khabaradhaar shavee | 63 | 1 |
translation: Times are such that they will demand alertness every moment. (63) (1)

gurmukhi: zW Agr hsq, nswir kdim jwnW kun
transliteration: zaa(n) agar hasatha, nasaar kadham jaanaa(n) kuna
translation: If you have life in you, you should sacrifice it at the feet of the beloved,

gurmukhi: idl b-idldwr bidh, zW ik: idldwr SvI ]63]2]
transliteration: dhil ba-dhiladhaar badhiha, zaa(n) ki: dhiladhaar shavee | 63 | 2 |
translation: O heart! You should offer yourself uninhibitingly to your beloved so that you would also be loved. (63) (2)

gurmukhi: mMzil ieSk drwz Asq bw-pw n-qqvW r&q
transliteration: manzal eishak dharaaz asath baa-paa na-thathavaa(n) rafatha
translation: Destination of love is too far and long; it cannot be reached using the feet,

gurmukhi: sr kdm swz, ik: qw dr rwih AW Xwr SvI ]63]3]
transliteration: sar kadham saaza, ki: thaa dhar raahi aaa(n) yaar shavee | 63 | 3 |
translation: Sacrifice your head, make it your feet before you embark on the road to your beloved. (63) (3)

gurmukhi: gu&qgUey hmw ks dr iedrwik ^ud Asq
transliteration: gufathagooeae hamaa kas dhar eidharaak khudh asatha
translation: Everyone indulges into conversation according to his wits,

gurmukhi: lb i&robMd ik: qw mhrim iesrwr SvI ]63]4]
transliteration: lab firobandh ki: thaa meharam eisaraar shavee | 63 | 4 |
translation: However, you should keep your lips tightly closed if you are anxious to share the secrets of the beloved. (63) (4)

gurmukhi: my &roSd idil dIvwnw-ie ^ud rw, goieAw
transliteration: mae faroshadh dhil dheevaanaa-e khudh raa, goeiaa
translation: Goyaa says, I want to sell myself and my insane heart to my beloved,

gurmukhi: bw aumIid krim AW, ik: ^rIdwr SvI ]63]5]
transliteration: baa oumeedh karam aaa(n), ki: khareedhaar shavee | 63 | 5 |
translation: With my faith in his grace and mercy, I am sure he will find it worthy of buying. (63) (5)

gurmukhi: rubweIAwx
transliteration: rubaaeeaana
translation: 4-Line Verses

gurmukhi: hr ks iz SOik qU kdm Az sr sw^q
transliteration: har kas z shaauak thoo kadham az sar saakhatha
translation: Everyone, with his zeal for you, started to walk on his head,

gurmukhi: br nhu qbk cri^ Alm sr A&rw^q
transliteration: bar nahu thabak charakh alam sar afaraakhatha
translation: And, he was able to pitch his flag over the nine skies,

gurmukhi: Sud AwmdnS mubwirk r&qn hm
transliteration: shudh aamadhanash mubaarik rafathan hama
translation: Blessed is his coming to this world, and equally blessed is his departure,

gurmukhi: goXw Awx ks ik rwih h?k rw ibSnw^q ]1]
transliteration: goyaa aan kas k raahi hak raa bishanaakhath | 1 |
translation: Goyaa says, The one who has perceived the Lord. (1)

gurmukhi: kUr Asq hr Awx dIdw ik h?k rw nBSnw^q
transliteration: koor asath har aan dheedhaa k hak raa nabhashanaakhatha
translation: Every such eye that did not recognize (the existence) of Akaalpurakh, can be considered as blind,

gurmukhi: eIx aumir igrwx mwXw b-Z&lq drbw^q
transliteration: een oumar giraan maayaa ba-ghafalath dharabaakhatha
translation: He wasted this precious life in negligence and carelessness,

gurmukhi: aU igrIAwx kunwx Awmd b-hsrq murd
transliteration: oo gireeaan kunaan aamadh ba-hasarath muradha
translation: He came (to this world) crying and passed away taking all his yearnings and unfulfilled hopes with him,

gurmukhi: A&sos drIx Awmd Sud kwry nBsw^q ]2]
transliteration: afasos dhareen aamadh shudh kaarae nabhasaakhath | 2 |
translation: Alas! He was unable to better his disposition in this cycle of birth and death. (2)

gurmukhi: eIx cSim qU ^wnw dwir jwnwnsq
transliteration: een chasham thoo khaanaa dhaar jaanaanasatha
translation: This eye of yours is the abode of the Beloved virtuous friend,

gurmukhi: eIx q^iq vjUid msnid sulqwnsq
transliteration: een thakhath vajoodh masanadh sulathaanasatha
translation: Your personality is the seat of His royal throne,

gurmukhi: hr bUAlhvsy bsUie aU rwh n burd
transliteration: har booalehavasae basooe oo raah n buradha
translation: Anyone immersed in greed and lust cannot reach the powerful Almighty,

gurmukhi: ik eIx rwh qA?lik mMzil mrdwnsq ]3]
transliteration: k een raah thaalak manzal maradhaanasath | 3 |
translation: Because this path is meant for the brave and the valiant devotees of Waaheguru. (3)

gurmukhi: hr idl ik brwih rwsq jwnwx Sudw Asq
transliteration: har dhil k baraahi raasath jaanaan shudhaa asatha
translation: Every such heart and mind that spontaneously (by acquiring the virtues of) became the divine Beloved,

gurmukhi: qihkIk ibdwx ik AYin jwnwx Sudw Asq
transliteration: thehikeek bidhaan k ain jaanaan shudhaa asatha
translation: Rest assured! That he became the embodiment of Akaalpurakh Himself,

gurmukhi: X?k z?rw iz &Yiz rihmqS ^wlI nIsq
transliteration: yak zaraa z faiz rehimathash khaalee neesatha
translation: Not even a particle of dust is then without his benevolence and blessing,

gurmukhi: n?kws drUin nkS ipnhwx Sudw Asq ]4]
transliteration: nakaas dharoon nakash pinehaan shudhaa asath | 4 |
translation: And, the Sculptor-Painter is camouflaging Himself behind His colors. (4)

gurmukhi: eIx Awmdo r&q juz dmy byS nbUd
transliteration: een aamadho rafath juz dhamae baesh naboodh
translation: This coming and departing in this world is no more than a moment,

gurmukhi: hr jw ik nzr kunym juz ^yS nbUd
transliteration: har jaa k nazar kunaem juz khaesh naboodha
translation: Wherever we run our vision and see around, we see only our own images,

gurmukhi: mwx jwinib ZYr cUM Ningwh ibkunym
transliteration: maan jaanib ghair choon anigaah bikunaema
translation: How can we ever dare to look towards anyone else?

gurmukhi: cUM ZYr qU hIc ksy pso pyS nbUd ]5]
transliteration: choon ghair thoo heech kasae paso paesh naboodh | 5 |
translation: Because, there is no one else (except Waaheguru) in the front or rear who is supporting us. (5)

gurmukhi: hr bMdw kU qwilib mOlw bwSd
transliteration: har bandhaa koo thaalib maaualaa baashadha
translation: Every such person who is a seeker of the Divinity,

gurmukhi: dr hr do jhwx ruqbw-AMS aUlw bwSd
transliteration: dhar har dho jehaan ruthabaa-ansh oolaa baashadha
translation: Has a highest rank and status in both the worlds;

gurmukhi: goXw do jhwx rw b-jOey ib-sqwnMd
transliteration: goyaa dho jehaan raa ba-jaaueae bi-sathaanandha
translation: Goyaa says, They can acquire both the worlds in exchange for just a grain of barley,

gurmukhi: mjnUMin qU kY AwSik lYlw bwSd ]6]
transliteration: majanoonn thoo kai aashak lailaa baashadh | 6 |
translation: When and how would I, Your beloved (like Majnoo was) become Your lover (like Lailaa)? (6)

gurmukhi: dr dihr ik mrdwin ^udw Awmdw AMd
transliteration: dhar dhehir k maradhaan khudhaa aamadhaa andha
translation: When men of God manifest themselves in this world,

gurmukhi: br Zum-Sudgwin rihnumw Awmdw AMd
transliteration: bar ghuma-shudhagaan rehinumaa aamadhaa andha
translation: They come as leaders to put the strayed people on to the right path;

gurmukhi: goXw Agr eIN cSim qU muSqwik ^udw Asq
transliteration: goyaa agar ee chasham thoo mushathaak khudhaa asatha
translation: Goyaa says, If your eye is desirous of the Almighty,

gurmukhi: mrdwin ^udw ^udw-numw Awmdw AMd ]7]
transliteration: maradhaan khudhaa khudhaa-numaa aamadhaa andh | 7 |
translation: Then realize that the noble souls of God come to this earth only to reveal Him. (7)

gurmukhi: dr mzhib mw ZYr-prsqI n kunMd
transliteration: dhar mazehab maa ghaira-parasathee n kunandha
translation: People of our faith do not worship anyone else (other than Akaalpurakh),

gurmukhi: sr qw bkdm bhoS E msqI n kunMd
transliteration: sar thaa bakadham behosh ou masathee n kunandha
translation: They are always mindful and alert and never act or behave wantonly,

gurmukhi: Zw&il nSvMd Xk dm Az Xwid ^udw
transliteration: ghaafal nashavandh yak dham az yaadh khudhaa
translation: They are not negligent of the remembrance of Waaheguru even for one moment/breath,

gurmukhi: dIgr su^n Az bulMdo psqI n kunMd ]8]
transliteration: dheegar sukhan az bulandho pasathee n kunandh | 8 |
translation: Additionally, they do not get involved in topics relating to higher or lower classes of the society. (8)

gurmukhi: X?k z?rw Agr SOik ielwhI bwSd
transliteration: yak zaraa agar shaauak eilaahee baashadha
translation: If one has even the slightest inkling of fondness for the Lord,

gurmukhi: ibhqr ik hzwr bwdSwhI bwSd
transliteration: bihathar k hazaar baadhashaahee baashadha
translation: Then, that is far superior to thousands of kingdoms,

gurmukhi: goXw-sq Zulwim murSid ^yS
transliteration: goyaa-sath ghulaam murashadh khaesha
translation: Goyaa says, I am the slave of my true Guru,

gurmukhi: eIx ^q n muhqwij gvwhI bwSd ]9]
transliteration: een khath n muhathaaj gavaahee baashadh | 9 |
translation: And this written assertion does not need any witnesses. (9)

gurmukhi: hr ks b-jhw nSvo numw mI ^whd
transliteration: har kas ba-jehaa nashavo numaa mee khaahadha
translation: Every human being in this world likes to progressively prosper and professionally advance,

gurmukhi: Aspo Suqro &Ilo iqlw mI ^whd
transliteration: asapo shutharo feelo thilaa mee khaahadha
translation: He/She has strong desire to acquire horses, camels, elephants and gold;

gurmukhi: hr ks iz brwie ^yS cIzy mI ^whd
transliteration: har kas z baraae khaesh cheezae mee khaahadha
translation: Every one always longs to have something or the other for himself;

gurmukhi: goXw iz ^udw Xwid ^udw mI ^whd ]10]
transliteration: goyaa z khudhaa yaadh khudhaa mee khaahadh | 10 |
translation: However, Goyaa says, I always supplicate to the Lord to bless me only with His remembrance. (10)

gurmukhi: pur gSqw iz sr qw b-kdm nUr-aul-nUr
transliteration: pur gashathaa z sar thaa ba-kadham noora-oula-noora
translation: Goyaa says that His Guru is satiated with radiance and splendor from head to feet;

gurmukhi: AweInw ik dr vYn bvd hIc ksUr
transliteration: aaeenaa k dhar vain bavadh heech kasoora
translation: He is a mirror that has no cracks;

gurmukhi: qihkIk ibdwx iz Zwi&lwx dUr bvd
transliteration: thehikeek bidhaan z ghaafilaan dhoor bavadha
translation: Rest assured: That he shuns away from the careless and the negligent;

gurmukhi: aU dr idil Awir& krdw zhUr ]11]
transliteration: oo dhar dhil aarif karadhaa zehoor | 11 |
translation: And he manifests only in the hearts of holy and pious persons. (11)

gurmukhi: eIx aumir igrwx-mwXw ik brbwd Svd
transliteration: een oumar giraana-maayaa k barabaadh shavadha
translation: This priceless life that is wasted for nothing,

gurmukhi: eIx ^wnwie vIrwx b-ich Awbwd Svd
transliteration: een khaanaae veeraan ba-chih aabaadh shavadha
translation: And how can this desolate home be rehabilitated and settled?

gurmukhi: qw murSid kwiml nidhd dsq bRhm
transliteration: thaa murashadh kaamil nadhihadh dhasath brehama
translation: Goyaa says, (This can happen) Only when a complete Guru stands by your side and helps; And this may be the only way that

gurmukhi: goXw idil ZmgIn qU cUM Swd bvd ]12]
transliteration: goyaa dhil ghamageen thoo choon shaadh bavadh | 12 |
translation: My heart filled with worries and griefs can be elevated to elation? (12)

gurmukhi: idil zwlim b-ksid kuSqin mw-sq
transliteration: dhil zaalam ba-kasadh kushathan maa-satha
translation: The fiendish has the intention to destroy us,

gurmukhi: idil mzlUim mn bsUie ^udw sq
transliteration: dhil mazaloom man basooe khudhaa satha
translation: On the other hand, my vulnerable mind is expecting help and relief  from the Almighty;

gurmukhi: aU drIx i&kr qwx bmw ich kund
transliteration: oo dhareen fikar thaan bamaa chih kunadha
translation: The brute is concerned as to what should He do with him?

gurmukhi: mw drIx i&kr qw ^udw ich kund ]13]
transliteration: maa dhareen fikar thaa khudhaa chih kunadh | 13 |
translation: And, we are concerned as to how does the Almighty respond to our plea? (13)

gurmukhi: dr hwisil aumr Awx ich mw Xw&qw eym
transliteration: dhar haasil oumar aan chih maa yaafathaa eaema
translation: What did we gain from this priceless life?

gurmukhi: dr hr do-jhwx Xwid ^udw Xw&qw eym
transliteration: dhar har dho-jehaan yaadh khudhaa yaafathaa eaema
translation: We were able to achieve the remembrance of the Omnipotent in both the worlds;

gurmukhi: eIx hsqIey ^ySqn blw bUd AzIm
transliteration: een hasatheeeae khaeshathan balaa boodh azeema
translation: This personality of ours was a huge monster,

gurmukhi: Az ^yS guzSqym ^udw Xw&qw eym ]14]
transliteration: az khaesh guzashathaem khudhaa yaafathaa eaem | 14 |
translation: When we gave up our ego and vanity, we attained the Ultimate, the Lord. (14)

gurmukhi: Az ^wik dir qU qUqIAw Xw&qweym
transliteration: az khaak dhar thoo thootheeaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: We obtained collyrium from the dust of Your door;

gurmukhi: kz dOliq Awx nSvo numw Xw&qweym
transliteration: kaz dhaaualath aan nashavo numaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: Because of which we gained the prosperity and progress;

gurmukhi: mw isjdw br rUie ZYr dIgr nBkunym
transliteration: maa sijadhaa bar rooe ghair dheegar nabhakunaema
translation: We have never bowed before anyone other than You,

gurmukhi: dr ^wnwie idl nkiS ^udw Xw&qweym ]15]
transliteration: dhar khaanaae dhil nakash khudhaa yaafathaaeaem | 15 |
translation: We have discovered the symptoms of the Omnipresent within the abode of our heart. (15)

gurmukhi: goXw ^br Az Xwid ^udw Xw&qweym
transliteration: goyaa khabar az yaadh khudhaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: Goyaa says, I have been able to get the inkling about the kaalpurakh from His remembrance,

gurmukhi: eIx jwim lbw-lb Az kujw Xw&qweym
transliteration: een jaam labaa-lab az kujaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: Otherwise, how could I have obtained this full-to-the-brim cup of devotion and affection?

gurmukhi: juz qwilib h?k nsIib hr ks n bvd
transliteration: juz thaalib hak naseeb har kas n bavadha
translation: Except the seeker of Lord, no one else is destined to have

gurmukhi: eIx dOliq nwXwb ik mw Xw&qweym ]16]
transliteration: een dhaaualath naayaab k maa yaafathaaeaem | 16 |
translation: This valuable treasure that I have had the good fortunate to obtain. (16)

gurmukhi: goXw qw kY drIx srwey mwdUAm
transliteration: goyaa thaa kai dhareen saraaeae maadhooama
translation: Goyaa says, How long are you going to stay in this perishable world,

gurmukhi: gwhy lwzm Svd v gwhy mlzUm
transliteration: gaahae laazam shavadh v gaahae malazooma
translation: That sometimes becomes so essential and other times so assigned?

gurmukhi: qw kY cU sgwx br ausq^wx jMg kunym
transliteration: thaa kai choo sagaan bar ousathakhaan jang kunaema
translation: How long are we going to fight over bones like dogs ?

gurmukhi: duinAw mwlUAm Aihil duinAw mwlUAm ]17]
transliteration: dhuniaa maalooam ahil dhuniaa maalooam | 17 |
translation: We all know about this world and these worldly people, (how selfish and merciless they are). (17)

gurmukhi: goXw Agr Awx jmwl dIdn dwrI
transliteration: goyaa agar aan jamaal dheedhan dhaaree
translation: Goyaa says, If you desire to see the splendor and glory of Waaheguru?

gurmukhi: Az ^ud hvs mYil rmIdn dwrI
transliteration: az khudh havas mail rameedhan dhaaree
translation: If you are trying to shun away from the sin of your greed and lust and have the stomach for meidtation?

gurmukhi: zIx dIdw mbIx ik hzwb sq qurw
transliteration: zeen dheedhaa mabeen k hazaab sath thuraa
translation: Then you should not see with these overt and ostensible eyes, because they are the obstacle for you;

gurmukhi: by-dIdw ibbIx hr Awx ich dIdn dwrI ]18]
transliteration: bae-dheedhaa bibeen har aan chih dheedhan dhaaree | 18 |
translation: In fact, you should try to introspect without your eyes whatever you want to see. (And you would be successful) (18)

gurmukhi: mOjUd ^udwsq qU ikrw mI joeI
transliteration: maauajoodh khudhaasath thoo kiraa mee joee
translation: Akaalpurakh is Omnipresent. Then whom are you searching for?

translation: What is kingship and mendicancy? Understand that
