translation: How can the connoisseurs of truth get involved in self-ego?

gurmukhi: sr-bulMdwx moil pRsqI cUM kunMd ]51]
transliteration: sara-bulandhaan mol prasathee choon kunandh | 51 |
translation: How can the lofty-headed have any craving or cupidity for those lying in lower valleys (slopes)? (51)

gurmukhi: ^ud-pRsqI kqrwie nwpwik qU
transliteration: khudha-prasathee katharaae naapaak thoo
translation: This vanity is a dirty and soiled drop;

gurmukhi: Awx ik jw krdw b-muSiq ^wik qU ]52]
transliteration: aan k jaa karadhaa ba-mushath khaak thoo | 52 |
translation: That has made an abode for itself in your body of fist-full dirt. (52)

gurmukhi: ^ud-pRsqI ^wswie nwdwin qU
transliteration: khudha-prasathee khaasaae naadhaan thoo
translation: This self-ego is the trait and characteristic of your stupidity;

gurmukhi: h?k pRsqI mwieAwie eImwin qU ]53]
transliteration: hak prasathee maaeiaae eemaan thoo | 53 |
translation: And, worship of truth is the asset of your faith and belief. (53)

gurmukhi: ijsim qU Az bwdo ^wko AwiqS Asq
transliteration: jisam thoo az baadho khaako aathish asatha
translation: Your body is composed of wind, dust and fire;

gurmukhi: kqrwie AwbI nUir zwiqS Asq ]54]
transliteration: katharaae aabee noor zaathish asath | 54 |
translation: You are just a drop of water, and the radiance (life) in you is the bestowal of Akaalpurakh. (54)

gurmukhi: ^wnwAq Az nUir h?k rOSn Sudw
transliteration: khaanaaath az noor hak raauashan shudhaa
translation: Your abode-like mind has been radiant with the Divine splendor,

gurmukhi: X?k guly budI knUM gulSn Sudw ]55]
transliteration: yak gulae budhee kanoon gulashan shudhaa | 55 |
translation: You were just a flower (not long ago), now you are a full fledged garden embellished with scores and scores of flowers. (55)

gurmukhi: ps drUin gulSin ^ud sYr kun
transliteration: pas dharoon gulashan khudh sair kuna
translation: You should (enjoy) taking a walk inside this garden;

gurmukhi: hmcU muriZ mku?dis dr vY qYr kun ]56]
transliteration: hamachoo muragh makudhas dhar vai thair kun | 56 |
translation: And, soar around like a chaste and innocent bird in it. (56)

gurmukhi: sd hzwrwx ^uld AMdr ZoSw AS
transliteration: sadh hazaaraan khuladh andhar ghoshaa asha
translation: There are millions of heavenly gardens in His each and every nook and corner,

gurmukhi: hr do Awlm dwnwie Az ^oSw AS ]57]
transliteration: har dho aalam dhaanaae az khoshaa ash | 57 |
translation: Both these worlds are like just a grain off the ear of His corn. (57)

gurmukhi: kUiq Awx muriZ muk?ds Xwid aU
transliteration: kooth aan muragh mukadhas yaadh oo
translation: The feed of that pious bird is Akaalpurkah's remembrance,

gurmukhi: Xwid aU hwx Xwid aU hwx Xwid aU ]58]
transliteration: yaadh oo haan yaadh oo haan yaadh oo | 58 |
translation: His remembrance, only His meditation, yes only His memory. (58)

gurmukhi: hr ksy kU mwieil ^udw-sq
transliteration: har kasae koo maaeil khudhaa-satha
translation: Anyone who is (sincerely) devoted to His meditation;

gurmukhi: ^wik rwhS qUiqAwie cSim mw-sq ]59]
transliteration: khaak raahash thoothiaae chasham maa-sath | 59 |
translation: The dust of his path is like a collyrium for our eyes. (59)

gurmukhi: gr qurw Xwid ^udw hwisl Svd
transliteration: gar thuraa yaadh khudhaa haasil shavadha
translation: If you can get attuned to the meditation of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: h?il hr muSikl qurw, AY idl Svd ]60]
transliteration: hal har mushakil thuraa, ai dhil shavadh | 60 |
translation: Then O mind of mine! You should understand that all your difficulties have been solved (solutions to all the problems have been found). (60)

gurmukhi: h?il hr muSikl hmIx Xwid ^udw-sq
transliteration: hal har mushakil hameen yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: The only solution to every predicament is remembering Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: hr ik Xwid h?k kund zwiq ^udw-sq ]61]
transliteration: har k yaadh hak kunadh zaath khudhaa-sath | 61 |
translation: In fact, a rememberer of (the Naam of) Waaheguru conforms himself into the same category as the Waaheguru Himself. (61)

gurmukhi: dr hkIkq ZYr h?k mnzUr nIsq
transliteration: dhar hakeekath ghair hak manazoor neesatha
translation: In reality, nothing but the Lord Himself is the acceptable Entity;

gurmukhi: kIsq AY jwn kU srwpw nUr nIsq ]62]
transliteration: keesath ai jaan koo saraapaa noor neesath | 62 |
translation: O my mind! Who is such a person that does not reflect the radiance of Akaalpurakh from head to toes? (62)

gurmukhi: kqrwie nUrI srwpw nUr bwS
transliteration: katharaae nooree saraapaa noor baasha
translation: O human being! You are one of the rays of the Divine glow, and become engulfed in divine radiance from head to toes,

gurmukhi: ibguzr Az Zm dwiemw msrUr bwS ]63]
transliteration: biguzar az gham dhaaeimaa masaroor baash | 63 |
translation: Get rid of any worries or suspicions, and get inebriated permanently in His memory. (63)

gurmukhi: qw bkY dr bMid Zm bwSI mdwm
transliteration: thaa bakai dhar bandh gham baashee madhaama
translation: How long would you be in the never-ending captivity of anxieties?

gurmukhi: ibguzr Az Zm Xwid h?k kun v-slwm ]64]
transliteration: biguzar az gham yaadh hak kun va-salaam | 64 |
translation: Get rid of sorrows and griefs; remember the Lord and stay safe and secure for ever. (64)

gurmukhi: Zm ich bwSd ZPlq Az Xwid ^udw
transliteration: gham chih baashadh ghafalath az yaadh khudhaa
translation: What is distress and depression? It is the negligence of His meditation;

gurmukhi: cIsq SwdI Xwid Awx by-imnqhw ]65]
transliteration: cheesath shaadhee yaadh aan bae-minathehaa | 65 |
translation: What is pleasure and joy? It is the remembrance of the Almighty of infinite dimensions. (65)

gurmukhi: mwAnIie by-imMqhw dwnI ik cIsq
transliteration: maaaneee bae-minthehaa dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: Do you know the meaning of the Illimitable?

gurmukhi: Awx ik aU nwied bkYid mrgo zIsq ]66]
transliteration: aan k oo naaeidh bakaidh marago zeesath | 66 |
translation: It is the Boundless, the Akaalpurakh, who is not subjected to births and deaths. (66)

gurmukhi: dr sir hr mrdo zn sOdwie aU-sq
transliteration: dhar sar har maradho zan saauadhaae oo-satha
translation: Every man and woman in his/her head is overwhelmed with His ardor;

gurmukhi: dr do Awlm SorSy ZOZwie aU-sq ]67]
transliteration: dhar dho aalam shorashae ghaauaghaae oo-sath | 67 |
translation: All this excitement in both the worlds is His creation. (67)

gurmukhi: mMzil aU br zubwin AOlIAw-sq
transliteration: manzal oo bar zubaan aaualeeaa-satha
translation: It is the tongue of the saints and noble souls where He has made His abode;

gurmukhi: rUzy Sb kwxdr idlS Xwid ^udw-sq ]68]
transliteration: roozae shab kaanadhar dhilash yaadh khudhaa-sath | 68 |
translation: Or He abides in their hearts where there is constant remembrance of Him day and night. (68)

gurmukhi: cSim aU br ZYr hriZz vw nw-Sud
transliteration: chasham oo bar ghair haraghiz vaa naa-shudha
translation: The eyes of a meditator never open up to see anyone or anything else but Him;

gurmukhi: kqrwie aU juz sUie dirAw nBSud ]69]
transliteration: katharaae oo juz sooe dhariaa nabhashudh | 69 |
translation: And, his drop (of water), every breath, does not flow towards any other place except towards the vast ocean (the Akaalpurakh). (69)

gurmukhi: bMdwie aU swihb hr do srw
transliteration: bandhaae oo saahib har dho saraa
translation: A man of God is the master of both the worlds;

gurmukhi: kU n bInd ZYr nkiS ikbrIAw ]70]
transliteration: koo n beenadh ghair nakash kibareeaa | 70 |
translation: Because, he does not see anything else other than the Great Embodiment of Truth. (70)

gurmukhi: eIx jhwno Awx jhwx &wnI bvd
transliteration: een jehaano aan jehaan faanee bavadha
translation: This and the next world both are perishable;

gurmukhi: ZYir XwdS jumlw nwdwnI bvd ]71]
transliteration: ghair  yaadhash  jumalaa naadhaanee bavadh | 71 |
translation: Everything else other than His remembrance is a complete foolishness. (71)

gurmukhi: Xwd kun hwx qwx qvwnI Xwd kun
transliteration: yaadh kun haan thaan thavaanee yaadh kuna
translation: Remember Akaalpurakh: You should remember Him as much as you can;

gurmukhi: ^wnw rw Az Xwid h?k Awbwd kun ]72]
transliteration: khaanaa raa az yaadh hak aabaadh kun | 72 |
translation: And, populate your home-like heart/mind with His constant remembrance. (72)

gurmukhi: eIx idil qU ^wnwie h?k bUdw Asq
transliteration: een dhil thoo khaanaae hak boodhaa asatha
translation: Your heart/mind is nothing but the abode of God;

gurmukhi: mn ikh goiem h?k cunIx &rmUdw Asq ]73]
transliteration: man kih goeim hak chuneen faramoodhaa asath | 73 |
translation: What can I say! This is what is the edict of God Himself (73)

gurmukhi: Swh bw qU hmnSIno hm zubwx
transliteration: shaah baa thoo hamanasheeno ham zubaana
translation: Your (true) companion and constantly affirming your viewpoint is the King of the world, the Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: qU b-sUie hr kso nwks dvwx ]74]
transliteration: thoo ba-sooe har kaso naakas dhavaan | 74 |
translation: But, you keep running after every person for having your desires fulfilled. (74)

gurmukhi: vwie qU br jwin qU Aihvwil qU
transliteration: vaae thoo bar jaan thoo ahivaal thoo
translation: Goyaa says, I feel sorry for you, for your life and for your state of mind;

gurmukhi: vwie br eIx ZPlqo A&Awil qU ]75]
transliteration: vaae bar een ghafalatho afaaal thoo | 75 |
translation: I feel sorry for your negligence (for not remembering Him) and for the conduct of your life. (75)

gurmukhi: hr ksy kU qwilib dIdwr Sud
transliteration: har kasae koo thaalib dheedhaar shudha
translation: Anyone who is desirous and anxious to get a glimpse of Him,

gurmukhi: pyiS cSmS jumlw nkiS Xwr Sud ]76]
transliteration: paesh chashamash jumalaa nakash yaar shudh | 76 |
translation: In his view, every visible and living thing conforms into His own image. (76)

gurmukhi: drimAwin nkS n?kwS Asqo bs
transliteration: dharamiaan nakash nakaash asatho basa
translation: It is the same Artist that sparkles Himself in every portrait,

gurmukhi: eIN s^un rw dr nXwbd bUAl-hvs ]77]
transliteration: ee sakhun raa dhar nayaabadh booala-havas | 77 |
translation: However, this mystery cannot be understood by the human beings. (77)

gurmukhi: gr qU mI^wnI iz ieSik h?k sbk
transliteration: gar thoo meekhaanee z eishak hak sabaka
translation: If you want to get a lesson on devotion to Waaheguru, then

gurmukhi: Xwid h?k kun Xwid h?k kun Xwid h?k ]78]
transliteration: yaadh hak kun yaadh hak kun yaadh hak | 78 |
translation: You should remember Him; in fact, you should constantly keep remembering Him. (78)

gurmukhi: AY brwdr Xwid h?k dwnI ik cIsq
transliteration: ai baraadhar yaadh hak dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: O brother! Do you know how to define remembrance of Waaheguru?

gurmukhi: AMdrUin jumlw idlhwie jwie kIsq ]79]
transliteration: andharoon jumalaa dhilehaae jaae keesath | 79 |
translation: And, who is it who abides in the hearts and minds of everyone ? (79)

gurmukhi: cUM drUin jumlw idlhw swie aUsq
transliteration: choon dharoon jumalaa dhilehaa saae oosatha
translation: When it is His image that prevails in the hearts of every one,

gurmukhi: ^wnwie idl mMzlo mwvwie aUsq ]80]
transliteration: khaanaae dhil manzalo maavaae oosath | 80 |
translation: That means that the home-like heart is the destination and asylum for Him.(80)

gurmukhi: cUM ibdwinsqI ik dr idlhw ^udw-sq
transliteration: choon bidhaanisathee k dhar dhilehaa khudhaa-satha
translation: When you learn that it is the Omnipotent who abides in everyone's heart and mind,

gurmukhi: ps qurw Awdwib hr idl mudAw-sq ]81]
transliteration: pas thuraa aadhaab har dhil mudhaaa-sath | 81 |
translation: Then, it should be your principal purpose (of life) to be respectful to everyone's heart. (81)

gurmukhi: Xwid h?k eInsqo dIgr Xwd nIsq
transliteration: yaadh hak eenasatho dheegar yaadh neesatha
translation: This is what is called the meditation of Waaheguru; there is no other remembrance,

gurmukhi: hr ikrw eIx Zm nBbwSd Swd nIsq ]82]
transliteration: har kiraa een gham nabhabaashadh shaadh neesath | 82 |
translation: Whosoever is not anxious about this fact, is not a happy soul. (82)

gurmukhi: izMdgI ie Awir&wx Xwid ^udw-sq
transliteration: zindhagee e aarifaan yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: Meditation is (the chief aim of) the whole life of God-enlightened persons;

gurmukhi: Az ^udw dUr Asq hr kU ^ud-numwsq ]83]
transliteration: az khudhaa dhoor asath har koo khudha-numaasath | 83 |
translation: A person who is stuck in his self ego is driven farther and farther away from Waaheguru. (83)

gurmukhi: kIsq goXw muSiq ^wik byS nIsq
transliteration: keesath goyaa mushath khaak baesh neesatha
translation: O Goyaa! What is your existence in life?  It is no more than a handful of dust;

gurmukhi: Awx hm AMdr A^iqAwr ^yS nIsq ]84]
transliteration: aan ham andhar akhathiaar khaesh neesath | 84 |
translation: And, even that is not under your control; The body that we claim to own is not under our control either. (84)

gurmukhi: h?k ik h&qwdo do im?lq AwPrId
transliteration: hak k hafathaadho dho mlith aafareedha
translation: Akaalpurakh created seventy two communities,

gurmukhi: i&rkwie nwjI AzIhwx br guzId ]85]
transliteration: firakaae naajee azeehaan bar guzeedh | 85 |
translation: Out of which, He designated the Naajee community as the most elite. (85)

gurmukhi: i&rkwie nwjI ibdwx by-ieSqbwh
transliteration: firakaae naajee bidhaan bae-eishathabaaha
translation: We should consider the Naajee (who is considered above and beyond the cycles of transmigration) community, without any doubt,

gurmukhi: hsq h&qwdo do im?lq rw pnwh ]86]
transliteration: hasath hafathaadho dho mlith raa panaah | 86 |
translation: As the shelter for the seventy two clans. (86)

gurmukhi: mrdmwnS hr Xky pwkIzw qr
transliteration: maradhamaanash har yakae paakeezaa thara
translation: Every member of this Najee community is sacred;

gurmukhi: ^Ub-rU E ^Ub-^U E ^uS-sIAr ]87]
transliteration: khooba-roo ou khooba-khoo ou khusha-seear | 87 |
translation: Beautiful and handsome, well mannered with a noble disposition. (87)

gurmukhi: pyiS Swx juz Xwid h?k mnzUr nIsq
transliteration: paesh shaan juz yaadh hak manazoor neesatha
translation: To these folks, nothing else but the remembrance of Akaalpurakh is acceptable;

gurmukhi: ZYr hri& bMdgI dsqUr nIsq ]88]
transliteration: ghair haraf bandhagee dhasathoor neesath | 88 |
translation: And, they do not have any tradition or mannerism other than the recitation of the words of prayer. (88)

gurmukhi: mIckd Az hri& Swx kMdo nbwq
transliteration: meechakadh az haraf shaan kandho nabaath
translation: Utter sweetness oozes out of their words and conversation,

gurmukhi: bwrd Az hr mUie Swx Awib hXwq ]89]
transliteration: baaradh az har mooe shaan aab hayaath | 89 |
translation: And, divine elixir is showered from every hair of theirs. (89)

gurmukhi: &wirZ AMd Az buZzo kInw E iz hsd
transliteration: faarigh andh az bughazo keenaa ou z hasadha
translation: They are above and beyond any form of jealousy, hostility or enmity;

gurmukhi: br nmI-Awied Az eySwx i&Ail bd ]90]
transliteration: bar namee-aaeidh az eaeshaan fial badh | 90 |
translation: They never commit any sinful acts. (90)

gurmukhi: hr ksy rw ie?zqo hurmq kunMd
transliteration: har kasae raa ezitho huramath kunandha
translation: They extend respect and honor to every one;

gurmukhi: mu&lsy rw swihib dOlq kunMd ]91]
transliteration: mufalasae raa saahib dhaaualath kunandh | 91 |
translation: And, they help poor and needy to become rich and opulent. (91)

gurmukhi: murdw rw Awib-hYvwx mIidhMd
transliteration: muradhaa raa aabi-haivaan meedhihandha
translation: They bless the dead souls with divine nectar;

gurmukhi: hr idly pzmurdw rw jwx mIidhMd ]92]
transliteration: har dhilae pazamuradhaa raa jaan meedhihandh | 92 |
translation: They bestow new and rejuvenated life to withered and demoralized minds. (92)

gurmukhi: sbz mIswzMd coib ^uSk rw
transliteration: sabaz meesaazandh chob khushak raa
translation: They can transform dry wood into green twigs;

gurmukhi: bUey mIbKSMd rMig muSk rw ]93]
transliteration: booeae meebakhashandh rang mushak raa | 93 |
translation: They also can convert a stinking odor into scented musk. (93)

gurmukhi: jumlw ASrw& AMd dr zwqo is&wq
transliteration: jumalaa asharaaf andh dhar zaatho sifaatha
translation: All these well-intentioned persons possess noble personal qualities;

gurmukhi: qwilib zwq AMd ^ud hm Awin zwq ]94]
transliteration: thaalib zaath andh khudh ham aan zaath | 94 |
translation: They are all seekers of Waaheguru's Entity; in fact, they are just like Him (are His image). (94)

gurmukhi: ^Uie Swx ielmo Adb rw muzhr Asq
transliteration: khooe shaan eilamo adhab raa muzehar asatha
translation: Learning and literature emerges (spontaneously) from their behavior;

gurmukhi: rUie Swx rOSn iz imhir Anvr Asq ]95]
transliteration: rooe shaan raauashan z mihar anavar asath | 95 |
translation: And, their faces radiate like the glowing divinely sun. (95)

gurmukhi: im?liq Swx kOim mskInwx bvd
transliteration: mlith shaan kaauam masakeenaan bavadha
translation: Their clan consists of a group of humble, meek and gentle persons;

gurmukhi: hr do Awlm Swieik eInwx bvd ]96]
transliteration: har dho aalam shaaeik eenaan bavadh | 96 |
translation: And they have devotees in both the worlds; People in both the worlds believe in them. (96)

gurmukhi: kOim imskIx kOim mrdwin ^udw-sq
transliteration: kaauam misakeen kaauam maradhaan khudhaa-satha
translation: This group of people is the community of gentle and humble souls, a community of God's men.

gurmukhi: eIx hmw &wnI v aU dwiem bkwsq ]97]
transliteration: een hamaa faanee v oo dhaaeim bakaasath | 97 |
translation: Every thing that we see is destructible, but Akaalpurakh is the only One that prevails perpetually and is Imperishable. (97)

gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx ^wk rw AksIr krd
transliteration: suhabath shaan khaak raa akaseer karadha
translation: Their company and association transformed even the dust to an effective cure.

gurmukhi: luqi& Swx br hr idly qwsIr krd ]98]
transliteration: luthaf shaan bar har dhilae thaaseer karadh | 98 |
translation: Their blessings effectively impressed every heart. (98)

gurmukhi: hr ik b-eySwx nSInd X?k dmy
transliteration: har k ba-eaeshaan nasheenadh yak dhamae
translation: Anyone who enjoys their company just once even for a moment,

gurmukhi: rUiz &rdw rw kujw dwrd Zmyx ]99]
transliteration: rooz faradhaa raa kujaa dhaaradh ghamaen | 99 |
translation: He, then, does not have to be apprehensive about the day of reckoning. (99)

gurmukhi: Awx ic dr sd-swlw aumrS nBXw&q
transliteration: aan ch dhar sadha-saalaa oumarash nabhayaafatha
translation: A person who could not attain much in spite of hundreds of years of life,

gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx hmcU ^urSIdS ibqw^q ]100]
transliteration: suhabath shaan hamachoo khurasheedhash bithaakhath | 100 |
translation: Shone like a sun when he joined the company of  these people. (100)

gurmukhi: mw ik Az iehswin Swx SrimMdw-eym
transliteration: maa k az eihasaan shaan sharamindhaa-eaema
translation: We are obligated and owe them a debt of gratitude,

gurmukhi: bMdwie iehswin Swx rw bMdw eym ]101]
transliteration: bandhaae eihasaan shaan raa bandhaa eaem | 101 |
translation: We are, in fact, persons/products of their favors and kindness. (101)

gurmukhi: sd hzwrwx hmcU mn kurbwin Swx
transliteration: sadh hazaaraan hamachoo man kurabaan shaana
translation: Millions like me are willing to sacrifice themselves for these nobilities;

gurmukhi: hb ic goiem km bvd dr Swin Swx ]102]
transliteration: hab ch goeim kam bavadh dhar shaan shaan | 102 |
translation: No matter how much I say in their honor and praise, it will be inadequate. (102)

gurmukhi: Swin Swx bIrUM bvd Az gu&qgU
transliteration: shaan shaan beeroon bavadh az gufathagoo
translation: Their honor and appreciation is beyond any words or expression;

gurmukhi: jwmwie Swx pwk Az Susqo SU ]103]
transliteration: jaamaae shaan paak az shusatho shoo | 103 |
translation: The style (attire) of their life is cleaner and chaste than any amount of washing or rinsing. (103)

gurmukhi: dwx XkIx qw cMd eIx duinAw bvd
transliteration: dhaan yakeen thaa chandh een dhuniaa bavadha
translation: Believe me ! How long is this world going to last? Only for a short time;

gurmukhi: Aw^irS kwir qU bw mOlw bvd ]104]
transliteration: aakharish kaar thoo baa maaualaa bavadh | 104 |
translation: Ultimately, we have to develop and maintain a relationship with the Almighty. (104)

gurmukhi: ps z A?vl kun hdIis Swh rw
transliteration: pas z aval kun hadhees shaah raa
translation: Now you indulge yourself in the stories and discourses of (that) King, the Waaheguru.

gurmukhi: pYrvI kun hwdIey eIx rwh rw ]105]
transliteration: pairavee kun haadheeeae een raah raa | 105 |
translation: And, follow the Guide who shows you the direction (of life). (105)

gurmukhi: qw qU hm XwbI murwid aumr rw
transliteration: thaa thoo ham yaabee muraadh oumar raa
translation: So that your life's hopes and ambitions are fulfilled;

gurmukhi: lzqy XwbI z SOik ikbrIAw ]106]
transliteration: lazathae yaabee z shaauak kibareeaa | 106 |
translation: And, you can have the pleasure of the savor of the devotion for Akaalpurakh.(106)

gurmukhi: jwihl Awx-jw swihib-idl mISvd
transliteration: jaahil aana-jaa saahibi-dhil meeshavadha
translation: (With His grace) even s stupid person can become an intellectual and enlightened;

gurmukhi: Zrik driAwE bswihl mISvd ]107]
transliteration: gharak dharaaiaaou basaahil meeshavadh | 107 |
translation: And, a person drowning in deep waters of a river can reach the banks. (107)

gurmukhi: nw iks Awx jw Awir& kwiml Svd

translation: We, under the influence of meditation, have sought his (His) shelter and refuge. (222)

gurmukhi: aU brMig swihib &rmW rvw
transliteration: oo barang saahib faramaa(n) ravaa
translation: Accepting Waaheguru's Will, he is the king of the world and his command prevails all over;

gurmukhi: mw brMig bMdgI inzdS gdw ]223]
transliteration: maa barang bandhagee nizadhash gadhaa | 223 |
translation: We, under the influence of meditation, are just beggars before him. (223)

gurmukhi: aU brMig swihbI dwrd nzr
transliteration: oo barang saahibee dhaaradh nazara
translation: He, while imbued in accepting Master's Will, keeps a close watch on us;

gurmukhi: bMdw rw Az bMdgI bwSd ^br ]224]
transliteration: bandhaa raa az bandhagee baashadh khabar | 224 |
translation: And, one can get to know him only through meditation. (224)

gurmukhi: aumr hw joXwie eIN dOlq SudMd
transliteration: oumar haa joyaae ee dhaaualath shudhandha
translation: They kept looking for such a treasure for ages;

gurmukhi: swlhw muSqwik eIN suhbq SudMd ]225]
transliteration: saalehaa mushathaak ee suhabath shudhandh | 225 |
translation: They were anxiously desirous of such a company for years. (225)

gurmukhi: hr ksy rw z?rw zW bwSd nsIb
transliteration: har kasae raa zaraa zaa(n) baashadh naseeba
translation: Anyone who was fortunate enough to attain even an atomic particle of such a wealth,

gurmukhi: AwN b^UbI gSq ^urSIid njIb ]226]
transliteration: aa bakhoobee gashath khurasheedh najeeb | 226 |
translation: He became an extraordinary sun easily and spontaneously. (226)

gurmukhi: gYr aU XwAnI iz h?k g&lq bvd
transliteration: gair oo yaaanee z hak gafalath bavadha
translation: The underlying meaning of living without the memory of Waaheguru is complete ignorance and naivety.

gurmukhi: Xwid aU srmwXwie dOlq bvd ]227]
transliteration: yaadh oo saramaayaae dhaaualath bavadh | 227 |
translation: The valuable asset of the remembrance of Akaalpurakh becomes the treasure of some fortunate beings. (227)

gurmukhi: dIdin h?k qw muX?sr mI-Svd
transliteration: dheedhan hak thaa muyasar mee-shavadha
translation: One can get a glimpse of the Omnipotent only

gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdW qAsur mI-Svd ]228]
transliteration: suhabath maradhaa(n) thaasur mee-shavadh | 228 |
translation: When one's association with noble saints become fruitful. (228)

gurmukhi: hri& h?k dr idl Agr mwvw kund
transliteration: haraf hak dhar dhil agar maavaa kunadha
translation: If someone can abide even one word of Truth in his heart,

gurmukhi: dr buin hr mUie aU h?k jw kund ]229]
transliteration: dhar bun har mooe oo hak jaa kunadh | 229 |
translation: Then, Truth but nothing but the Truth gets assimilated to the roots of each of his hair. (229)

gurmukhi: hr ik ^ud rw sUie h?k mI-AwdrS
transliteration: har k khudh raa sooe hak mee-aadharasha
translation: Anyone who can direct himself towards the divine path of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: Az rui^ aU nUir-h?k mI-bwrdS ]230]
transliteration: az rukh oo noori-hak mee-baaradhash | 230 |
translation: God's glory and splendor radiates from his face. (230)

gurmukhi: eIN hmw &Yj Az qu&Yil suhbq Asq
transliteration: ee hamaa faij az thufail suhabath asatha
translation: All this benevolence and benignity is because of them and their blessings,

gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k ^uS dOlq Asq ]231]
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak khush dhaaualath asath | 231 |
translation: The company of saintly persons (of God) is one priceless asset. (231)

gurmukhi: hIc ks Az hwil SW Awgwh nIsq
transliteration: heech kas az haal shaa(n) aagaah neesatha
translation: No one really understands or appreciates the state of mind of these noble royalties;

transliteration: har k ou mih raa dharaa(n)jaa raah neesath | 232 |
translation: Every Tom, Dick or Harry does not have the wherewithal to reach there (them). (232)

gurmukhi: dr nzr AwieMd cUM zwiq A?lwh

translation: In appearance, they look just like an embodiment of the specie of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: dr hkIkq hr do Awlm Apnwh ]233]
transliteration: dhar hakeekath har dho aalam apanaah | 233 |
translation: In reality, they are the refuge for everyone in both the worlds. (233)

gurmukhi: dr ksb bwSMd Awzwd Az ksb
transliteration: dhar kasab baashandh aazaadh az kasaba
translation: While engaged in their professions or trades, they are still unattached and unduly engrossed in them;

translation: They spend their lives in remembering the Provident (day and night). (234)

gurmukhi: ^yS rw cUM mUr ibSnwsMd SW
transliteration: khaesh raa choon moor bishanaasandh shaa(n)
translation: They, the noble souls, consider themselves (out of humility) just like an ant,

gurmukhi: dr hkIkq ibhqr Az pIil dmW ]235]
transliteration: dhar hakeekath bihathar az peel dhamaa(n) | 235 |
translation: Even though they, in fact, might be more powerful than a ferocious and dangerous elephant. (235)

gurmukhi: hr ic mI-bInI hmw hYrwin SwN
transliteration: har ch mee-beenee hamaa hairaan shaa
translation: Whatever you are seeing in this world is simply astonished and confounded about them;

gurmukhi: Swin SW ibhqr bvd Az iemiqhW ]236]
transliteration: shaan shaa(n) bihathar bavadh az eimathihaa(n) | 236 |
translation: Their splendor and aura is far superior than even that of the examinations. (236)

gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k bwSd krm
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak baashadh karama

gurmukhi: dOlqy kAwN rw nBbwSd hIc Zm ]237]
transliteration: dhaaualathae kaaa raa nabhabaashadh heech gham | 237 |
translation: Such a wealth and virtuosity does not suffer from any anxiety or grief. (237)

gurmukhi: ^ud bzurgo hr ksy SW inSsq
transliteration: khudh bazurago har kasae shaa(n) nishasatha
translation: They, themselves, are elevated, mature and blessed; anyone who happens to  be bestowed with their company;

transliteration: oo bazuragee yaafath thaa(n) har jaa k hasath | 238 |
translation: He, too, becomes elevated, mature and blessed, and receives laurels everywhere. (238)

gurmukhi: hr ksy kU ^yS rw ibSnw^qw
transliteration: har kasae koo khaesh raa bishanaakhathaa
translation: Anyone who has recognized his own reality;

gurmukhi: dr qrIik bMdgI prdw^qw ]239]
transliteration: dhar thareek bandhagee paradhaakhathaa | 239 |
translation: Consider that he has adopted the mode or the method of meditation. (239)

gurmukhi: eIN zmIno AwsmW pur Az ^udw-sq
transliteration: ee zameeno aasamaa(n) pur az khudhaa-satha
translation: This earth and the skies are saturated with (the creations of ) God,

gurmukhi: Awlmy hr sU dvW kAwN Sih kujw-sq ]240]
transliteration: aalamae har soo dhavaa(n) kaaa shehi kujaa-sath | 240 |

gurmukhi: dIdw br dIdwir h?k gr mubqlw-sq

translation: If you can aim your eyes fixedly on a glimpse of Akaalpurakh,

transliteration: har chih mee beenee bachashamath haka-numaa-sath | 241 |
translation: Then, whatever you see will be a vision of the Almighty Waaheguru. (241)

gurmukhi: hr ik SW rw dId h?k rw dIdw Asq

gurmukhi: qriz X?k-rMgI Ajb rMg AwrdS

translation: The focus on devotion for God brings in with it an unusual complexion of disposition,

gurmukhi: kz bdn nUir ^udw mI-bwrdS ]243]

gurmukhi: aU brMig swihbI eIN hsqo bUd

gurmukhi: bMdgI dwiem b-Awdwb sjUd ]244]
transliteration: bandhagee dhaaeim ba-aadhaab sajoodh | 244 |

gurmukhi: bMdgI qw sr kdm bubXwid aU ]245]

gurmukhi: swihby bw swihbW zybd mudwm

gurmukhi: bMdw rw dr bMdgI bwSd ikAwm ]246]
transliteration: bandhaa raa dhar bandhagee baashadh kiaam | 246 |

gurmukhi: swihbW rw swihbI bwSd SuAwr
transliteration: saahibaa(n) raa saahibee baashadh shuaara
translation: The character of Masters is to be master-like,

gurmukhi: bMdw rw dr bMdgI &sil bhwr ]247]
transliteration: bandhaa raa dhar bandhagee fasal behaar | 247 |

gurmukhi: swihbW rw swihbI dwiem bvd

gurmukhi: bMdw hm dr bMdgI kwiem bvd ]248]
transliteration: bandhaa ham dhar bandhagee kaaeim bavadh | 248 |

gurmukhi: Az brwie AwN ik qU sr-gSqweI
transliteration: az baraae aa k thoo sara-gashathaaee
translation: For this, you have turned your head away from Him, you have strayed;

gurmukhi: Az pey duinAw iz h?k br-gSqweI ]249]
transliteration: az peae dhuniaa z hak bara-gashathaaee | 249 |
translation: That you have turned your face away from Him just for the sake of this material  world. (249)

gurmukhi: dOliq gIqI n bwSd pwiedwr
transliteration: dhaaualath geethee n baashadh paaeidhaara
translation: The worldly riches are not going to last for ever,

gurmukhi: X?k n&s ^ud rw bsUie h?k ibAwr ]250]

gurmukhi: cUM idil qU mwieil Xwid ^udw-sq

gurmukhi: gr qU Zwi&l-bwSI Az i&kir bulMd

gurmukhi: Xwid aU drid do Awlm rw dvw-sq

transliteration: yaadh oo har guma-shudhaa raa raahanumaa sath | 253 |
translation: His memory also directs all lost and strayed ones to the correct path. (253)

gurmukhi: hr ik Zwi&l Sud Azo mulzm Svd ]254]
transliteration: har k ghaafil shudh azo mulazam shavadh | 254 |

gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI bMdw rw qO&Ik idh

gurmukhi: ibguzrd dIgr nBbwSd mudAw ]256]

transliteration: ghair yaadhash ee dhil maa shaadh neesath | 257 |

transliteration: ai zehae dhaaualath k baashadh raahanumaa | 258 |
translation: How fortunate we are that it shows us the direction (in our lives)!(258)

gurmukhi: gr ic h?k dr jumlwie idlhw bvd
transliteration: gar ch hak dhar jumalaae dhilehaa bavadha

translation: Still, only an enlightened persons can be called 'a man of faith and religion'. (259)

translation: Only the eye of an enlightened person deserves a glimpse of the Almighty;

gurmukhi: mrid AwirP vwiki& Asrwr hsq ]260]
transliteration: maradh aarif vaakif asaraar hasath | 260 |
translation: And, it is only the heart of a knowledgeable person who is familiar with His mysteries. (260)

gurmukhi: qw qU hm grdI iz XmnS rusqgwr ]261]
transliteration: thaa thoo ham garadhee z yamanash rusathagaar | 261 |
translation: So that, with the Providential blessings, you may be redeemed from the cycles of transmigration. (261)

transliteration: har chih hasath az suhabath eeshaa(n) bavadha
translation: Whatever is visible in this world is all due to company of saintly persons;

transliteration: zaa(n) k jisamo jaa saraapaa jaa(n) bavadh | 262 |
translation: Because our bodies and souls are, in fact, the soul of the Provident. (262)

translation: The pupils of my eyes are fully lighted only because of their company;

gurmukhi: ^wik ijsmm jumlw gulSn Sud Azo ]263]

translation: And, the dirt of my body, for the same reason, is transformed into a lush garden. (263)

translation: Blessed is that association that has transformed a dirt into a cure-all;

gurmukhi: nwksy rw swihib qdbIr krd ]264]
transliteration: naakasae raa saahib thadhabeer karadh | 264 |
translation: And, converted every lowly uniformed person into knowledgeable and intelligent. (264)

translation: All these worldly diamonds and pearls are perishable;

transliteration: yaadh hak bar bandhaa arazaanee bavadh | 266 |
translation: The remembrance of Waaheguru, however, is extremely valuable for a human being. (266)

transliteration: rasam maradhaan khudhaa dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: Do you know what is the custom and tradition of the devotees of Omnipotent?

gurmukhi: &wirZ AMd Az kYdhwie mrjo zIsq ]267]
transliteration: faarigh andh az kaidhehaae marajo zeesath | 267 |
translation: They are redeemed and are free from the imprisonment of the cycles of births and deaths for ever. (267)

gurmukhi: X?k n&s by Xwid h?k nBguzwSqMd
transliteration: yak nafas bae yaadh hak nabhaguzaashathandha
translation: They do not spend even one moment without remembering Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ^uS Awlm br nhu qbk APrwSqMd ]268]
transliteration: khush aalam bar nahu thabak afaraashathandh | 268 |
translation: They unfurl their beautiful flag (of meditation) over all the nine skies. (268)

gurmukhi: ^Yr^wih julgI pYdwieS AMd
transliteration: khairakhaahi julagee paidhaaeish andha
translation: They wish and pray for the well-being of the entire created world,

gurmukhi: zyb b^iS eIN hmw AwrwieS AMd ]269]
transliteration: zaeb bakhash ee hamaa aaraaeish andh | 269 |
translation: It is them who bless all these creations and natural beauties with grace and elegance. (269)

gurmukhi: nwim h?k mrdwin h?k rw zyvr Asq

translation: The Naam of Waaheguru is an ornament for His noble and saintly devotees,

gurmukhi: cSim SW Az nUir h?k pur gOhr Asq ]270]
transliteration: chasham shaa(n) az noor hak pur gaauehar asath | 270 |
translation: And, the eye of these nobilities is always full of pearls and gems because of the refulgent glow of the Almighty. (270)

gurmukhi: hri& SW qwAlIim aumir jwivdW

translation: Their words are a lessons for a permanent life,

gurmukhi: Xwid h?k dwrMd dwiem br zubW ]271]
transliteration: yaadh hak dhaarandh dhaaeim bar zubaa(n) | 271 |
translation: And, the memory of Akaalpurakh abides on their lips/tongue for ever. (271)

gurmukhi: hr ich mIgoieMd ArSwdsqo bs
transliteration: har chih meegoeindh arashaadhasatho basa
translation: Their utterances have the status of the words of Divine,

gurmukhi: br nmI AwrMd ZYr Az h?k n&s ]272]
transliteration: bar namee aarandh ghair az hak nafas | 272 |
translation: And, not even one breath of theirs is spent without remembering Him. (272)

gurmukhi: eIN hmw muSqwik dIdwir ^udw-sq
transliteration: ee hamaa mushathaak dheedhaar khudhaa-satha
translation: All these saintly persons are really seekers of a Divine glimpse,

gurmukhi: bosqwin dihr gulzwir ^udw-sq ]273]
transliteration: bosathaan dhehir gulazaar khudhaa-sath | 273 |
translation: And, this delightful worldly spread is, in fact, a heavenly flower bed. (273)

gurmukhi: hr ik bw-mrdwin h?k Sud AwSnw

translation: Whosoever developed a friendship with the devotees of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: swieAwie aU ibhqr Az bwil humw ]274]
transliteration: saaeiaae oo bihathar az baal humaa | 274 |
translation: Take it that his shadow (on them) will be many times more blessed than the shadow of the feathers of  the Humaa bird (It is said that a shadow of Humaa bird can bestow the kingdom of the world). (274)

gurmukhi: Xwid h?k XwAnI iz ^ud ibZuzSqn Asq
transliteration: yaadh hak yaaanee z khudh bighuzashathan asatha
translation: We should take it that getting absorbed in Waaheguru's meditation is to give up self-ego,

gurmukhi: Az i^Awil ZYir h?k vwrusqn Asq ]275]

translation: And, not thinking about Him would get us stuck in every other worldly attraction. (275)

gurmukhi: rsqgI Az ^ySqn vwrsqgI-sq
transliteration: rasathagee az khaeshathan vaarasathagee-satha
translation: To redeem ourselves from our egos is the real emancipation,

gurmukhi: bw ^udwie ^ySqn idl-bsqgI-sq ]276]
transliteration: baa khudhaae khaeshathan dhila-basathagee-sath | 276 |
translation: And, to tie up our minds with Waaheguru's devotion is also real deliverance. (276)

gurmukhi: hr ks kU bw ^udw idl bsqw Asq
transliteration: har kas koo baa khudhaa dhil basathaa asatha
translation: Whosoever has linked and attached his mind to the Almighty,

gurmukhi: aU z cri^ nhu qbk br-jsqw Asq ]277]
transliteration: oo z charakh nahu thabak bara-jasathaa asath | 277 |
translation: Take it that he has easily leaped over a sky equipped even with nine locks. (277)

gurmukhi: suhbiq idl-bsqgwin bw ^udw
transliteration: suhabath dhila-basathagaan baa khudhaa
translation: The company of such God-attached devotees,

gurmukhi: kY muX?sr Awiedq eIN kImIAw ]278]
transliteration: kai muyasar aaeidhath ee keemeeaa | 278 |
translation: Take it that it is the cure-all; however, how can we be fortunate enough to obtain it? (278)

gurmukhi: dIno duinAw hr do hYrW mWdw AMd
transliteration: dheeno dhuniaa har dho hairaa(n) maa(n)dhaa andha
translation: Both the faith and the religion are amazed,

gurmukhi: bs z hYrwnI pRISW mWdw AMd ]279]
transliteration: bas z hairaanee preeshaa(n) maa(n)dhaa andh | 279 |
translation: And in this amazement beyond limits they are perplexed. (279)

gurmukhi: hr ikh rw eIN AwrzUey pwk hsq
transliteration: har kih raa ee aarazooeae paak hasatha
translation: Whosoever imbibes such a chaste and divine desire,

gurmukhi: murSid aU swihib Adrwk hsq ]280]
transliteration: murashadh oo saahib adharaak hasath | 280 |
translation: His Guru (teacher) is the master of innate and intrinsic knowledge. (280)

gurmukhi: vwislwin-h?k qurw vwisl kunMd
transliteration: vaasilaani-hak thuraa vaasil kunandha
translation: God connected noble saints can make your connection with Him,

gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId rw hwisl kunMd ]281]
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh raa haasil kunandh | 281 |
translation: They can also help you to obtain the eternal treasure, the Naam. (281)

gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId pyiS Awir& Asq
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh paesh aarif asatha
translation: This is an immortal achievement for an enlightened person,

gurmukhi: eIN s^un mShUr bs muqAwir& Asq ]282]
transliteration: ee sakhun mashehoor bas muthaaarif asath | 282 |
translation: This adage is commonly well known, and everyone is well acquainted with it. (282)

gurmukhi: Awir&wno kwimlwno vwislW
transliteration: aarifaano kaamilaano vaasilaa(n)
translation: The enlightened, perfect and submerged into the love of God devotees;

gurmukhi: nwim aU dwrd dwiem br zubW ]283]
transliteration: naam oo dhaaradh dhaaeim bar zubaa(n) | 283 |
translation: They always have His Naam on their tongues and lips in meditation. (283)

gurmukhi: bMdgIie SW bvd izkir ^udw
transliteration: bandhageee shaa(n) bavadh zikar khudhaa
translation: To continually meditate on His Naam is their worship;

gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId bwSd h?k-numw ]284]
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh baashadh haka-numaa | 284 |
translation: And, the eternal treasure blessed by Akaalpurakh directs one towards His path. (284)

gurmukhi: cUM numwied dOliq jwvId rU
transliteration: choon numaaeidh dhaaualath jaaveedh roo
translation: When the divine eternal treasure shows Its face,

gurmukhi: qU z h?k bwSI vw h?k bwSd z qU ]285]
transliteration: thoo z hak baashee vaa hak baashadh z thoo | 285 |
translation: You would then belong to Waaheguru and He would belong to you. (285)

gurmukhi: br idlq gr prqvy h?k br&gMd
transliteration: bar dhilath gar parathavae hak barafagandha
translation: If the shadow of Akaalpurakh falls on someone's heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ^wir ihjrq rw z pwie idl kunMd ]286]
transliteration: khaar hijarath raa z paae dhil kunandh | 286 |
translation: Then take it that the painful thorn of separation has been extracted out of the foot (depth) of our mind. (286)

gurmukhi: ^wir ihjr Az pwie idl cUM dUr Sud
transliteration: khaar hijar az paae dhil choon dhoor shudha
translation: When the thorn of separation has been removed from the feet of the heart,

gurmukhi: ^wnwie idl Az ^udw mwmUr Sud ]287]
transliteration: khaanaae dhil az khudhaa maamoor shudh | 287 |
translation: Take it then that the Akaalpurakh has made the temple of our heart as His abode. (287)

gurmukhi: hmcU kqrw kU bdirAw dr &qwd
transliteration: hamachoo katharaa koo badhariaa dhar fathaadha
translation: Like that drop of water that fell into a river or ocean, giving up its own identity (showing humility),

gurmukhi: AYn dirAw gSqo vslS dsqdwd ]288]
transliteration: ain dhariaa gashatho vasalash dhasathadhaadh | 288 |
translation: It itself became the river and the ocean; (thus falling on the feet of Aakaalpurakh), and convergence with Him took place. (288)

gurmukhi: kqrw cUM Sud bdirAw AwSnw
transliteration: katharaa choon shudh badhariaa aashanaa
translation: Once the drop merges into the ocean,

gurmukhi: bwAd AzW q&rIk nqvW Sud z jw ]289]
transliteration: baaadh azaa(n) thafareek nathavaa(n) shudh z jaa | 289 |
translation: After that, it cannot be separated from the ocean. (289)

gurmukhi: kqrw cUM jwinib dirAw Sqw&q
transliteration: katharaa choon jaanib dhariaa shathaafatha
translation: When the drop started to rush in the direction of the ocean,

gurmukhi: Az rih q&rIk ^ud rw kqrw Xw&q ]290]
transliteration: az rehi thafareek khudh raa katharaa yaafath | 290 |
translation: It, then, realized the significance of being just a drop of water. (290)

gurmukhi: kqrw rw eIN dOliq cUM dsqdwd
transliteration: katharaa raa ee dhaaualath choon dhasathadhaadha
translation: When the drop was bestowed with this eternal meeting,

gurmukhi: kqrw Sud AMdr hkIkq bw-murwd ]291]
transliteration: katharaa shudh andhar hakeekath baa-muraadh | 291 |
translation: The reality dawned on it, and its long-cherished desire was fulfilled. (291)

gurmukhi: gu&q mn X?k kqrw AwbI bUdw Am
transliteration: gufath man yak katharaa aabee boodhaa ama
translation: The droplet said, Even though I am a small drop of water,

gurmukhi: pYhin dirAw rw cunW pYmUdw Am ]292]
transliteration: paihan dhariaa raa chunaa(n) paimoodhaa am | 292 |
translation: I have been able to measure the expanse of this huge ocean. (292)

gurmukhi: gr mrw dr bwz rwih luqi& ^yS
transliteration: gar maraa dhar baaz raahi luthaf khaesha
translation: If the ocean, out of its extreme kindness, would agree to take me in,

gurmukhi: vwisl ^ud krd Az AMdwzw byS ]293]
transliteration: vaasil khudh karadh az andhaazaa baesh | 293 |
translation: And, it agreed to merge me into itself even beyond its capacity; (293)

gurmukhi: hmcU mOj Az pYhin dirAw rU nmUd
transliteration: hamachoo maauaj az paihan dhariaa roo namoodha
translation: And, it rose like a tidal wave out of the span of the ocean,

gurmukhi: mOj gSq vw krd dirAw rw sjUd ]294]
transliteration: maauaj gashath vaa karadh dhariaa raa sajoodh | 294 |
translation: It became another wave, and then bowed in reverence to the ocean. (294)

gurmukhi: hm cunW hr bMdw ku vwisl Asq
transliteration: ham chunaa(n) har bandhaa k vaasil asatha
translation: In the same manner, every such person who had a confluence with the Almighty,

gurmukhi: dr qrIik bMdgI bs kwiml Asq ]295]
transliteration: dhar thareek bandhagee bas kaamil asath | 295 |
translation: Became complete and perfect on the path of meditation. (295)

gurmukhi: mOjO dirAw gr ic dr mwAnI Xkysq
transliteration: maauajaau dhariaa gar ch dhar maaanee yakaesatha
translation: In reality, a wave and the ocean are one and the same,

gurmukhi: lyk AMdr eIno AwN &rky bsysq ]296]
transliteration: laek andhar eeno aa farakae basaesath | 296 |
translation: But still there is a vast difference between them. (296)

gurmukhi: mn Xky mOjm qU bihir bykrW
transliteration: man yakae maauajam thoo behir baekaraa(n)
translation: I am just a simple wave, while you are an enormously large ocean,

gurmukhi: &rk bwSd Az zmIno AwsmW ]297]
transliteration: farak baashadh az zameeno aasamaa(n) | 297 |
translation: Thus, there is a big difference between you and me like that between the earth and the sky. (297)

gurmukhi: mn nIA?m eIN jumlw Az Alqwi& qU
transliteration: man neeam ee jumalaa az alathaaf thoo
translation: I am nothing; all this (that I am) is only because of your blessings,

gurmukhi: mn X?k mOjm z qbAwie swi& qU ]298]
transliteration: man yak maauajam z thabaaae saaf thoo | 298 |
translation: I am, too, one wave in Your vast manifest world. (298)

gurmukhi: bw bzurgW suhbqy mI bwiedq
transliteration: baa bazuragaa(n) suhabathae mee baaeidhatha
translation: You would need the association with the noble persons,

gurmukhi: Az humw A?vl hmIN mI bwiedq ]299]
transliteration: az humaa aval hamee mee baaeidhath | 299 |
translation: This will be the first and the foremost thing that you will need. (299)

gurmukhi: kwdir muqilk bkudrq zwihr Asq
transliteration: kaadhar muthalik bakudharath zaahir asatha
translation: That perfect and complete Creator is visible through His own creations,

gurmukhi: drimAwin kudriq ^ud kwdr Asq ]300]
transliteration: dharamiaan kudharath khudh kaadhar asath | 300 |
translation: The Creator, in fact, abides amidst His own Nature and manifestations. (300)

gurmukhi: kwdro kudrq bhm Awmy^qMd
transliteration: kaadharo kudharath beham aamaekhathandha
translation: The Creator and His creations are one and the same,

gurmukhi: AwN mqwie ZYr h?k rw ry^qMd ]301]
transliteration: aa mathaae ghair hak raa raekhathandh | 301 |
translation: They, the noble persons, renounce all material distractions except the Provident. (301)

gurmukhi: ps qurw hm bwied AY Xwir AzIz
transliteration: pas thuraa ham baaeidh ai yaar azeeza
translation: O my dear friend! Then you should also make a judgement and conclude,

gurmukhi: h?k kudwm vw qU kudwmI kun qmIz ]302]
transliteration: hak kudhaam vaa thoo kudhaamee kun thameez | 302 |
translation: As to who is God, and who you are, and how to distinguish between the two. (302)

gurmukhi: gr qU vwisl gSqweI dr zwiq aU
transliteration: gar thoo vaasil gashathaaee dhar zaath oo
translation: If, in your pursuits, you happen to have a meeting with the Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ZYr hri& bMdgI dIgr mgU ]303]
transliteration: ghair haraf bandhagee dheegar magoo | 303 |
translation: Then you should not utter any other word except the word of worship and meditation. (303)

gurmukhi: eIN hmw Az dOliq eIN bMdgIsq
transliteration: ee hamaa az dhaaualath ee bandhageesatha
translation: All this tangible and non-tangible boons are because of the meditation,

gurmukhi: izMdgI by-bMdgI SrimMdgisq ]304]
transliteration: zindhagee bae-bandhagee sharamindhagasith | 304 |
translation: Without meditation, this life of ours is only mortification and humiliation. (304)

gurmukhi: h?k qwAlw bMdgI &rmUdw Asq
transliteration: hak thaaalaa bandhagee faramoodhaa asatha
translation: The Almighty God has also said,

gurmukhi: hr ksy kU bMdw Sud AwsUdw Asq ]305]
transliteration: har kasae koo bandhaa shudh aasoodhaa asath | 305 |
translation: Anyone who transformed himself into a man of God is redeemed. (305)

gurmukhi: cUM AnAlh?k br zubW iezhwr krd
transliteration: choon anaalehak bar zubaa(n) eizehaar karadha

gurmukhi: msqIey h?k mwAnIie huiSAwrI Asq
transliteration: masatheeeae hak maaaneee hushiaaree asatha

gurmukhi: Awir&W rw ^wb hm bydwrI Asq ]307]
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa khaab ham baedhaaree asath | 307 |
translation: Even dreaming while asleep for the knowledgeable is indeed like staying awake. (307)

gurmukhi: dr hkIkq by-Adb Xwbd szw
transliteration: dhar hakeekath bae-adhab yaabadh sazaa
translation: In reality, a disrespectful faces the consequences (reaps the fruits) of his own actions,

gurmukhi: cUM Awdb Amd hmw rw rhwnumw ]308]
transliteration: choon aadhab amadh hamaa raa rehaanumaa | 308 |

gurmukhi: gr qU sr qw pw hmw h?k gSqweI
transliteration: gar thoo sar thaa paa hamaa hak gashathaaee
translation: If you have transformed yourself from head to toe into Akaalpurakh's form,

transliteration: vaasil bae-choon muthalik gashathaaee | 309 |
translation: And, If you have merged into that unparalleled and matchless Waaheguru, (309)

transliteration: baaz raahi bandhagee dhar paesh geera
translation: Then you should adopt the path of meditation,

gurmukhi: bMdwie aU bwS vw rwih KyS gIr ]310]
transliteration: bandhaae oo baash vaa raahi khaesh geer | 310 |
translation: And, become His (favorite) person by holding on to the divine spiritual  passage  of meditation. (310)

gurmukhi: dr hmw hwlq ^udw hwzr bbIN
transliteration: dhar hamaa haalath khudhaa haazar babee
translation: One should assume His presence under all circumstances,

gurmukhi: hwizro nwizr hmwN nwizr bbIN ]311]
transliteration: haaziro naazir hamaa naazir babee | 311 |
translation: Considering Him Omnipresent and Immanent, and also take it that He is capable of seeing everything everywhere. (311)

gurmukhi: dr rwih h?k juz Adb qwAlIm nIsq
transliteration: dhar raahi hak juz adhab thaaaleem neesatha
translation: There is no education except that of respect and civility in the path of God,

gurmukhi: qwilib aU rw bjuz qslIm nIsq ]312]
transliteration: thaalib oo raa bajuz thasaleem neesath | 312 |

gurmukhi: qwilbwin h?k hmySw bw Adb
transliteration: thaalibaan hak hamaeshaa baa adhaba
translation: The seekers of the Divine Spirit are always respectful,

gurmukhi: bw Adb bwSMd AMdr Xwid r?b ]313]
transliteration: baa adhab baashandh andhar yaadh rab | 313 |
translation: They are also satiated with reverence while remembering Him. (313)

gurmukhi: byAdb rw kY iz rwih SW ^br
transliteration: baeadhab raa kai z raahi shaa(n) khabara
translation: What does an apostate know about the tradition of those noble persons?

gurmukhi: byAdb Az h?k hmySW by-Asr ]314]
transliteration: baeadhab az hak hamaeshaa(n) bae-asar | 314 |
translation: The efforts of an atheist to get a glimpse of Akaalpurakh will always be ineffective. (314)

gurmukhi: byAdb hrigz b-h?k rwih nXw&q
transliteration: baeadhab haragiz ba-hak raahi nayaafatha
translation: A disrespectful can never find the path leading towards the Divine Spirit;

gurmukhi: rwih h?k rw rIc gumrwhy nXw&q ]315]
transliteration: raahi hak raa reech gumaraahae nayaafath | 315 |
translation: No strayed person has ever been able to find the path of God and much less to reach Him. (315)

gurmukhi: hwdIey rwih ^udw Awmd Adb
transliteration: haadheeeae raahi khudhaa aamadh adhaba
translation: It is reverence that is the guide to the path of Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: by-Adb ^wlI-sq Az Alqwi& r?b ]316]
transliteration: bae-adhab khaalee-sath az alathaaf rab | 316 |
translation: And, an atheist remains blank from receiving His blessings. (316)

gurmukhi: by-Adb rwih ^udw kY dwndS
transliteration: bae-adhab raahi khudhaa kai dhaanadhasha
translation: How can an atheist find the way to the Almighty,

gurmukhi: hr ikrw kihir ^udw mIrwndS ]317]
transliteration: har kiraa kehir khudhaa meeraanadhash | 317 |
translation: Who has been condemned due to the anger of Waaheguru?(317)

gurmukhi: dr pnwih swieAwie mrdwin h?k
transliteration: dhar panaahi saaeiaae maradhaan haka
translation: If you care to seek the shelter (and agree to function in their shadow) of the noble souls of God,

gurmukhi: gr rvI AwN jw Adb XwbI sbk ]318]
transliteration: gar ravee aa jaa adhab yaabee sabak | 318 |
translation: You will receive teachings and instructions about respectability there. (318)

gurmukhi: by Adb eINjw Adb Awmoz Sud
transliteration: bae adhab eejaa adhab aamoz shudha
translation: Coming to this place (of noble persons), even the apostates become capable to teach lessons of reverence,

gurmukhi: eIN crwiZ gul jhW A&roz Sud ]319]
transliteration: ee charaagh gul jehaa(n) afaroz shudh | 319 |
translation: Here, even extinguished lamps begin to spread light throughout the world. (319)

gurmukhi: AY ^udw hr by Adb rw idh Adb
transliteration: ai khudhaa har bae adhab raa dhih adhaba
translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly bestow reverence even on the irreverent,

gurmukhi: qw guzwrd aumr rw dr Xwid r?b ]320]
transliteration: thaa guzaaradh oumar raa dhar yaadh rab | 320 |
translation: So that they can spend their lives in Your remembrance. (320)

gurmukhi: gr bXwbI l?zqy Az Xwid aU
transliteration: gar bayaabee lazathae az yaadh oo
translation: If you can relish the savor (sweet taste) of Waaheguru's remembrance,

gurmukhi: izMdw bwSI dwiemw AY nyk-KU ]321]
transliteration: zindhaa baashee dhaaeimaa ai naeka-khoo | 321 |
translation: Then O good man! You can become immortal. (321)

gurmukhi: eIN vjUid ^wk rw kwiem bdW
transliteration: ee vajoodh khaak raa kaaeim badhaa(n)
translation: Consider this body of dirt as permanent for this reason

gurmukhi: kwiem Awmd SOik aU dr ihriz jW ]322]
transliteration: kaaeim aamadh shaauak oo dhar hiraz jaa(n) | 322 |

gurmukhi: SOik mOlw izMdgIey jW bvd
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa zindhageeeae jaa(n) bavadha
translation: The love and elation for Akaalpurakh are the life-line of the soul,

gurmukhi: Xwid aU srmwAwie eImW bvd ]323]
transliteration: yaadh oo saramaaaae eemaa(n) bavadh | 323 |
translation: There is a wealth of faith and religion in His memory. (323)

gurmukhi: SOik aU dr hr idly kY jw kund
transliteration: shaauak oo dhar har dhilae kai jaa kunadha

gurmukhi: dr vjUid ^wk kY mwvw kund ]324]
transliteration: dhar vajoodh khaak kai maavaa kunadh | 324 |
translation: And, how can He take refuge in the body made up of dirt. (324)

gurmukhi: SOik mOlw mr qurw cUM dsqdwd
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa mar thuraa choon dhasathadhaadha
translation: When your fondness for Akaalpurakh supported you,

gurmukhi: dOliq dwiem bdsqq dr-&qwd ]325]
transliteration: dhaaualath dhaaeim badhasathath dhara-fathaadh | 325 |
translation: Then, take it for granted that you will obtain control and have the divine eternal wealth. (325)

gurmukhi: ^wik rwhS surmwie sr Asq
transliteration: khaak raahash suramaae sar asatha
translation: The dust of His path is like a collyrium for our eyes and head,

gurmukhi: Awir&W rw ibh z qwzo A&sr Asq ]326]
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa bih z thaazo afasar asath | 326 |
translation: This dust is much more valuable than the crown and the thrones for the enlightened. (326)

gurmukhi: dOliq duinAw nBbwSd pwiedwr
transliteration: dhaaualath dhuniaa nabhabaashadh paaeidhaara
translation: This worldly wealth is not ever lasting,

gurmukhi: dr qrIik Awir&win h?k guzwr ]327]
transliteration: dhar thareek aarifaan hak guzaar | 327 |
translation: You should accept this according to the verdict of the true devotees of God. (327)

gurmukhi: Xwid aU lwizm bvd dwiem qurw
transliteration: yaadh oo laazim bavadh dhaaeim thuraa
translation: Meditation of Waaheguru is always absolutely essential for you,

gurmukhi: izkir aU kwiem kund kwiem qurw ]328]
transliteration: zikar oo kaaeim kunadh kaaeim thuraa | 328 |
translation: And, the discourse about Him makes you steady and immovable forever. (328)

gurmukhi: Awir&W dwrMd bw ier&win ^yS
transliteration: aarifaa(n) dhaarandh baa eirafaan khaesha
translation: The devotees of Akaalpurakh are intimately connected to the divine knowledge,

gurmukhi: hwsil ier&W drUin jwin ^yS ]329]
transliteration: haasal eirafaa(n) dharoon jaan khaesh | 329 |
translation: And, the achievement of divine knowledge is completely absorbed inside their souls. (329)

gurmukhi: msnid SOik ielwhI by-zvwl
transliteration: masanadh shaauak eilaahee bae-zavaala
translation: The throne of devotion for Akaalpurakh is permanent and indestructible,

gurmukhi: vrnw bInI pur zvwly hr kmwl ]330]
transliteration: varanaa beenee pur zavaalae har kamaal | 330 |
translation: Although every peak has a trough. (330)

gurmukhi: by-zvwl Awmd kmwil zOik h?k
transliteration: bae-zavaal aamadh kamaal zaauak haka
translation: The marvel of the zest for God's love is eternal and non-destructible,

gurmukhi: qw ik Xwbd z?rw Az SOik h?k ]331]
transliteration: thaa k yaabadh zaraa az shaauak hak | 331 |
translation: Wish were it that we can get just one particle of His devotion. (331)

gurmukhi: hr ksy kU Xw&q aU jwvId Sud
transliteration: har kasae koo yaafath oo jaaveedh shudha
translation: Whosoever is lucky enough to obtain such a particle, he becomes immortal,

gurmukhi: dr hkIkq swihib aumId Sud ]332]
transliteration: dhar hakeekath saahib oumeedh shudh | 332 |
translation: In reality, his desire (to meet with Akaalpurakh) is fulfilled. (332)

gurmukhi: cUM aumIdS sUriq hwsl igR&q
transliteration: choon oumeedhash soorath haasal grifatha
translation: When he reached the stage of fulfillment,

gurmukhi: z?rw Az SOk jw dr idl igR&q ]333]
transliteration: zaraa az shaauak jaa dhar dhil grifath | 333 |
translation: That particle of the strong desire for His devotion gets seeded into his heart. (333)

gurmukhi: Awib hYvW mIckd Az mUie aU
transliteration: aab haivaa(n) meechakadh az mooe oo
translation: The divine nectar oozes out of his every hair,

gurmukhi: izMdw mIgrdd jhW Az bUie aU ]334]
transliteration: zindhaa meegaradhadh jehaa(n) az booe oo | 334 |
translation: And the whole world, with his aroma, becomes alive and rises up. (334)

gurmukhi: AY zhy iemswn ik h?k rw Xw&qw
transliteration: ai zehae eimasaan k hak raa yaafathaa
translation: Fortunate is that person who has attained the Provident;

gurmukhi: rU z Xwid gYir h?k br-qw&qw ]335]
transliteration: roo z yaadh gair hak bara-thaafathaa | 335 |
translation: And, who has turned himself away (detached) from every worldly items except the memory of God. (335)

gurmukhi: dr ilbwis duinXvI &wirZ AzW
transliteration: dhar libaas dhuniyavee faarigh azaa(n)
translation: Even while living in worldly guise, he is detached from every materialistic thing,

gurmukhi: dr i&rwkS vwlw E SYdw Sudw ]451]

translation: And, keeps wandering in His separation as a lunatic. (451)

gurmukhi: eIN mqwA AMdr dukwin h?k bvd
transliteration: ee mathaaa andhar dhukaan hak bavadha
translation: This true deal is available only at the shop of Truth,

gurmukhi: murSid kwiml inSwin h?k bvd ]452]
transliteration: murashadh kaamil nishaan hak bavadh | 452 |
translation: The complete and perfect Guru is the symbolic image of Akaalpurakh Himself. (452)

gurmukhi: murSid kwiml idhd pwkI qurw
transliteration: murashadh kaamil dhihadh paakee thuraa
translation: The perfect Guru, reference here is to Guru Gobind Singh Ji, bestows chastity and holiness upon you;

gurmukhi: mI kSd Az cwih ZmnwkI qurw ]453]
transliteration: mee kashadh az chaahi ghamanaakee thuraa | 453 |
translation: And, drags you out of the well (depths) of grief and sorrow. (453)

gurmukhi: murSid kwiml ielwij idl kund
transliteration: murashadh kaamil eilaaj dhil kunadha
translation: The perfect and true Guru removes the maladies of the heart,

gurmukhi: eIN murwid idl bidl hwisl kund ]454]
transliteration: ee muraadh dhil badhil haasil kunadh | 454 |
translation: With which, all the heart's desires are achieved (fulfilled) within the heart itself. (454)

gurmukhi: suhbiq Awir& Ajb dOlq bvd
transliteration: suhabath aarif ajab dhaaualath bavadha
translation: The company of noble souls is, by itself, an extraordinary wealth,

gurmukhi: eIN hmw mOkU& br suhbq bvd ]455]
transliteration: ee hamaa maauakoof bar suhabath bavadh | 455 |
translation: All this (these) is attained only through the support of the noble persons' company. (455)

gurmukhi: AY AzIiz mn iSnO Az mn s^un
transliteration: ai azeez man shinaau az man sakhuna
translation: O my dear ! Please listen to what I have to say,

gurmukhi: qw bXwbI rwh AMdr jwno qn ]456]
transliteration: thaa bayaabee raah andhar jaano than | 456 |
translation: So that you can realize the secret and mystery of life and the body. (456)

gurmukhi: qwilib mrdwin h?k rw dUsqdwr
transliteration: thaalib maradhaan hak raa dhoosathadhaara
translation: You should become friendly to the seekers of the Waaheguru's devotees,

gurmukhi: ZYr izkrS br zubW hr&y mXwr ]457]
transliteration: ghair zikarash bar zubaa(n) harafae mayaar | 457 |
translation: And should not bring any word other than the meditation of the Naam of Akaalpurakh on your tongue and lips. (457)

gurmukhi: ^wk SO mrdwin h?k rw ^wk bwS
transliteration: khaak shaau maradhaan hak raa khaak baasha
translation: You should become and act like dust, i.e., be humble, and become the dust of the passage of the holy men,

gurmukhi: ny pey dunIAwie dUM Zmnwk bwS ]458]
transliteration: nae peae dhuneeaae dhoon ghamanaak baash | 458 |
translation: And, do not worry about this frivolous and undignified world. (458)

gurmukhi: Zr qU ^wnI nus^w Az Swin ieSk
transliteration: ghar thoo khaanee nusakhaa az shaan eishaka
translation: If you can read the book of glory of romance,

gurmukhi: mISvI sr d&qir dIvwin ieSk ]459]
transliteration: meeshavee sar dhafathar dheevaan eishak | 459 |
translation: Then, you could become the address and headline of the book of love. (459)

gurmukhi: ieSik mOlw mr qurw mOlw kund
transliteration: eishak maaualaa mar thuraa maaualaa kunadha
translation: Love for Waaheguru transforms you into the very image of Waaheguru Himself,

gurmukhi: dr do Awlm imhqro AOlw kund ]460]
transliteration: dhar dho aalam mihatharo aaualaa kunadh | 460 |
translation: And, makes you lofty and famous in both the worlds. (460)

gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI eIN idlm rw SOk idh
transliteration: yaa eilaahee ee dhilam raa shaauak dhiha
translation: O my Akaalpurakh! Kindly bless this heart of mine with Your devotion and love,

gurmukhi: lzqy Az SOik ^wso zOk idh ]461]
transliteration: lazathae az shaauak khaaso zaauak dhih | 461 |
translation: And, also bestow upon me the savor of the euphoria of Your love. (461)

gurmukhi: qw b-Xwdq ibguzrd rUzo Sbm
transliteration: thaa ba-yaadhath biguzaradh roozo shabama
translation: So that, I can spend my days and nights remembering You,

gurmukhi: idh rhweI bMdw rw Az bMid Zm ]462]
transliteration: dhih rehaaee bandhaa raa az bandh gham | 462 |
translation: And, You bless me with redemption from the shackles of worries and griefs of this world. (462)

gurmukhi: dOlqy AwN idh ik bwSd pwiedwr
transliteration: dhaaualathae aa dhih k baashadh paaeidhaara
translation: Kindly bless me with such a treasure that should be permanent and everlasting,

gurmukhi: suhbqy AwN idh ik bwSd ZmZuswr ]463]
transliteration: suhabathae aa dhih k baashadh ghamaghusaar | 463 |
translation: Also bless me with the company (of such persons) that can dispel all my worries and griefs. (463)

gurmukhi: nIAqy AwN idh ik bwSd h?k guzwr
transliteration: neeathae aa dhih k baashadh hak guzaara
translation: Kindly bless me with such intentions and purposes that should worship the Truth,

gurmukhi: ihMmqy AwN idh ik bwSd jW inswr ]464]
transliteration: hinmathae aa dhih k baashadh jaa(n) nisaar | 464 |
translation: Kindly bless me with such a courage and fortitude that I should be prepared to sacrifice my life to venture to go on the road to God. (464)

gurmukhi: hr ich dwrd dr rihq kurbW kund
transliteration: har chih dhaaradh dhar rehith kurabaa(n) kunadha
translation: Whatever there is, he should be prepared to sacrifice on Your account,

gurmukhi: jwno idl kurbW rih subhW kund ]465]
transliteration: jaano dhil kurabaa(n) rehi subehaa(n) kunadh | 465 |
translation: Should also be prepared to sacrifice both the life and the soul on the path of Akaalpurakh. (465)

gurmukhi: dIdw-Am rw l?ziq dIdwr b^S
transliteration: dheedhaa-am raa lazath dheedhaar bakhasha
translation: Bless my eyes with the sweet taste of Your glimpse,

gurmukhi: sInw-Am rw m^zin Asrwr b^S ]466]
transliteration: seenaa-am raa makhazan asaraar bakhash | 466 |
translation: And, bless my heart with the treasures of Your mysteries and secrets. (466)

gurmukhi: eIN idil ibrXwin mw rw SOk idh
transliteration: ee dhil birayaan maa raa shaauak dhiha
translation: Kindly bless our charred hearts with the fervor (of Your love)

gurmukhi: dr Zuleym bMdgI rw qOk idh ]467]
transliteration: dhar ghuleaem bandhagee raa thaauak dhih | 467 |
translation: And, bless us with a strap (dog-collar) of meditation in our necks. (467)

gurmukhi: ihjir mw rw AwrzUie vsl b^S
transliteration: hijar maa raa aarazooe vasal bakhasha
translation: Please bless our separation (from you) with a strong yearning to meet with You,

gurmukhi: eIN i^zwin ijsim mw rw &jl b^S ]468]
transliteration: ee khizaan jisam maa raa fajal bakhash | 468 |
translation: And, bestow Your beneficence on the autumn-like-state of our bodies. (468)

gurmukhi: hr sir mUeym zubW kun Az krm
transliteration: har sar mooeaem zubaa(n) kun az karama
translation: Kindly transform, with your Benefaction, each hair on my body into a tongue,

gurmukhi: qw bgoeym vsi& h?k rw dm bdm ]469]
transliteration: thaa bagoeaem vasaf hak raa dham badham | 469 |
translation: So that I could keep uttering and singing Your kudos in my every breath after breath. (469)

gurmukhi: vsi& h?k bIrM bvd Az gu&qgU
transliteration: vasaf hak beeran bavadh az gufathagoo
translation: The eclat and glories of Akaalpurakh are beyond any words or conversation,

gurmukhi: eIN hdIis Swh bwSd kU b kY ]470]
transliteration: ee hadhees shaah baashadh koo b kai | 470 |
translation: This discourse and tale of the true King can be heard in every street after street. (470)

gurmukhi: mwAnIie eIN kU b-kU dwnI ik cIsq
transliteration: maaaneee ee koo ba-koo dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: Do you know as to what is the essence of this street?

gurmukhi: hmd go dIgr mgo eInsq zIsq ]471]
transliteration: hamadh go dheegar mago eenasath zeesath | 471 |
translation: You should utter only His approbations and nothing else. This is life. (471)

gurmukhi: zIsqn dr bMdgI aUlw bvd
transliteration: zeesathan dhar bandhagee oolaa bavadha
translation: It is superb to live with His constant meditation,

gurmukhi: gr ich sr qw pw hmw mUlw bvd ]472]
transliteration: gar chih sar thaa paa hamaa moolaa bavadh | 472 |
translation: Even though we may be the masters of the body from head to toes. (472)

gurmukhi: gr idhd qO&Ik &jil zuljlwl
transliteration: gar dhihadh thaauafeek fajal zulajalaala
translation: If the all Truth Akaalpurakh blesses someone with courage and capability,

gurmukhi: bMdw rw Az bMdgI bwSd kmwl ]473]
transliteration: bandhaa raa az bandhagee baashadh kamaal | 473 |
translation: Then that person can earn laurels because of meditation. (473)

gurmukhi: bMdgI bwSd kmwil bMdgI
transliteration: bandhagee baashadh kamaal bandhagee
translation: Meditation is the marvel and cornerstone of being a human being,

gurmukhi: bMdgI bwSd inSwin izMdgI ]474]
transliteration: bandhagee baashadh nishaan zindhagee | 474 |
translation: And, meditation is the real sign of being alive. (474)

gurmukhi: izMdgIie bMdw rw eIN bMdgIsq
transliteration: zindhageee bandhaa raa ee bandhageesatha
translation: The (purpose of) life of a human being is indeed the meditation of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: bMdgIie h?k ik AYn izMdgIsq ]475]
transliteration: bandhageee hak k ain zindhageesath | 475 |
translation: The remembrance of Waaheguru is the real (purpose of) life. (475)

gurmukhi: gr inSwin izMdgI mI-bwiedq
transliteration: gar nishaan zindhagee mee-baaeidhatha
translation: If you are looking for some signs and symbols of life for yourself,

gurmukhi: bMdgIie h?k qurw mI-Swiedq ]476]
transliteration: bandhageee hak thuraa mee-shaaeidhath | 476 |
translation: Then, it is absolutely appropriate for you to keep on meditating(on the Naam of Akaalpurakh). (476)

gurmukhi: qw qvwnI bMdw SO swihb mbwS
transliteration: thaa thavaanee bandhaa shaau saahib mabaasha
translation: As far as possible, you should become an humble person like a servant, and not an arrogant master,

gurmukhi: bMdw rw juz bMdgI nbvd qlwS ]477]
transliteration: bandhaa raa juz bandhagee nabavadh thalaash | 477 |
translation: A person should not be looking for anything in this world except meditation of the Almighty. (477)

gurmukhi: eIN vjUid ^wk pwk Az bMdgIsq
transliteration: ee vajoodh khaak paak az bandhageesatha
translation: This body of dust becomes sacred only due to the remembrance of the Provident,

gurmukhi: gu&qgUhwie idgr SrimMdgIsq ]478]
transliteration: gufathagoohaae dhigar sharamindhageesath | 478 |
translation: To get involved in any conversation other than the meditation will be nothing but an utter shame. (478)

gurmukhi: bMdgI kun zW ik aU bwSd kbUl
transliteration: bandhagee kun zaa(n) k oo baashadh kaboola
translation: You should meditate so that you become acceptable in His court,

gurmukhi: ibguzr Az ^ud-bInI E qriz zhUl ]479]
transliteration: biguzar az khudha-beenee ou tharaz zehool | 479 |
translation: And, give up the pattern of self ego and the way of life of that of an apostate. (479)

gurmukhi: dr idil swihib-idlW Awied psMd
transliteration: dhar dhil saahibi-dhilaa(n) aaeidh pasandh
translation: The meditation is extremely pleasing to the heart of the Master of all hearts,

gurmukhi: ruqbw-Aq grdd AzW hrdm bulMd ]480]
transliteration: ruthabaa-ath garadhadh azaa(n) haradham bulandh | 480 |
translation: Your status in this world remains high at all times only because of meditation. (480)

gurmukhi: murSid kwiml ik aU ArSwd krd
transliteration: murashadh kaamil k oo arashaadh karadha
translation: The perfect and true Guru said like this,

gurmukhi: eIN idlq Az Xwid h?k Awbwd krd ]481]
transliteration: ee dhilath az yaadh hak aabaadh karadh | 481 |
translation: He has inhabited you desolate heart with the remembrance of Waaheguru. (481)

gurmukhi: eIN hmw ArSwd dr idl nkS-bMd
transliteration: ee hamaa arashaadh dhar dhil nakasha-bandha
translation: You should etch this command of the perfectly true Guru in your heart,

gurmukhi: qw SvI dr hr do Awlm sr bulMd ]482]
transliteration: thaa shavee dhar har dho aalam sar bulandh | 482 |
translation: So that you can have your head high in both the worlds. (482)

gurmukhi: eIN vjUid ims qurw swzd iqlw
transliteration: ee vajoodh mis thuraa saazadh thilaa
translation: This command of the perfect and true Guru transforms your body of copper into that of gold,

gurmukhi: eIN iqlw mwAlUm Az Xwid ^udw ]483]
transliteration: ee thilaa maaaloom az yaadh khudhaa | 483 |
translation: And, this gold is realized only through the memory of Akaalpurakh. (483)

gurmukhi: AW iqlw &wnI vw sd mOiz blw
transliteration: aaa(n) thilaa faanee vaa sadh maauaz balaa
translation: This materialistic gold is destructible and is the root cause and whirlpool of  numerous problems and conflicts,

gurmukhi: eIN iqlw bwkI cU zwiq ikbrIAw ]484]
transliteration: ee thilaa baakee choo zaath kibareeaa | 484 |
translation: The gold of meditation, however, like the Entity of Omnipresent and True Waaheguru is permanent. (484)

gurmukhi: dOlq AMdr ^wik pwie mukblW
transliteration: dhaaualath andhar khaak paae mukabalaa(n)
translation: The (true) wealth is in the dust of the feet of the noble and accepted souls,

gurmukhi: dOlqy kW rw nmI AwXd izAwN ]485]
transliteration: dhaaualathae kaa(n) raa namee aayadh ziaa | 485 |
translation: It is such a true wealth that it is above and beyond any damage or loss. (485)

gurmukhi: Awkbq dIdI i^zW Awvurd bhwr
transliteration: aakabath dheedhee khizaa(n) aavuradh behaara
translation: You must have noticed that every spring brings in the autumn,

gurmukhi: vrnw dr duinAw hmw &sil bhwr ]486]
transliteration: varanaa dhar dhuniaa hamaa fasal behaar | 486 |
translation: Although the spring keeps coming into this world again and again. (486)

gurmukhi: eIN bhwir qwzw bwSd qw Abd
transliteration: ee behaar thaazaa baashadh thaa abadha
translation: However, this meditational form of spring remains fresh and new till the doomsday,

gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI dUr dwr Az NcSim bd ]487]
transliteration: yaa eilaahee dhoor dhaar az achasham badh | 487 |
translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly keep the influence of the evil eye far away from this spring . (487)

gurmukhi: hr ik ^wik pwie SW rw surmw Xw&q
transliteration: har k khaak paae shaa(n) raa suramaa yaafatha
translation: Anyone who happens to obtain the collyrium of the dust of the feet of the holy persons,

gurmukhi: br ru^S qihkIk nUir imhr qw&q ]488]
transliteration: bar rukhash thehikeek noor mihar thaafath | 488 |
translation: Rest assured that his face will shine like the brilliance and radiance of the divine sun. (488)

gurmukhi: Awiri& A?lwh dr dunIAwN bvd
transliteration: aarif alaah dhar dhuneeaa bavadha
translation: Even though spiritually enlightened person lives in this world,

gurmukhi: dr hkIkq qwilib mOlw bvd ]489]
transliteration: dhar hakeekath thaalib maaualaa bavadh | 489 |
translation: He, in fact, is always a seeker-devotee of the Waaheguru. (489)

gurmukhi: izkir mOlw dm b-dm dr jwin aU
transliteration: zikar maaualaa dham ba-dham dhar jaan oo
translation: He meditates and describes His virtues every breath of his life,

gurmukhi: Awieiq nwim ^udw dr Swin aU ]490]
transliteration: aaeith naam khudhaa dhar shaan oo | 490 |
translation: And, he recites verses of His Naam every moment in His honor. (490)

gurmukhi: hr n&s dwrMd idl rw sUie h?k
transliteration: har nafas dhaarandh dhil raa sooe haka
translation: They keep directing their hearts and concentrating towards thoughts about Him,

gurmukhi: Sud muA?qr mZiz SW Az bUie h?k ]491]
transliteration: shudh muathar maghaz shaa(n) az booe hak | 491 |
translation: They make their intellect fragrant with the aroma of the memory of Akaalpurakhb in every breath. (491)

gurmukhi: hr dmy kU bw ^udw vwisl bvd
transliteration: har dhamae koo baa khudhaa vaasil bavadha
translation: He always concentrates and is united with the Almighty at all times,

gurmukhi: hwisil eIN aumr rw hwisl bvd ]492]
transliteration: haasil ee oumar raa haasil bavadh | 492 |
translation: And, he has been able to achieve the real fruits of this life. (492)

gurmukhi: hwisil eIN aumr pyiS muriSd Asq
transliteration: haasil ee oumar paesh murashidh asatha
translation: The real fruits of this life lies with the Guru,

gurmukhi: nwim h?k cUM br zubwnS vwird Asq ]493]
transliteration: naam hak choon bar zubaanash vaaridh asath | 493 |
translation: And, silent repetition and meditation of His Naam is always on his tongue and the lips. (493)

gurmukhi: murSid kwiml bvd dIdwir h?k
transliteration: murashadh kaamil bavadh dheedhaar haka
translation: The true Guru is the apparent glimpse of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: kz zubwinS ibSnvI Asrwir h?k ]494]
transliteration: kaz zubaanish bishanavee asaraar hak | 494 |
translation: Therefore, you should listen to His mysteries from his tongue. (494)

gurmukhi: sUriq h?k murSid kwiml bvd
transliteration: soorath hak murashadh kaamil bavadha
translation: A true Guru is indeed a perfect personification of the image of God,

gurmukhi: nkiS aU dwiem drUin idl bvd ]495]
transliteration: nakash oo dhaaeim dharoon dhil bavadh | 495 |
translation: And, the image of Akaalpurakh always abides in his heart. (495)

gurmukhi: nkiS aU dr idil ks jw kund
transliteration: nakash oo dhar dhil kas jaa kunadha
translation: When His image resides permanently in someone's heart,

gurmukhi: hri& h?k AMdr idlS mwvw kund ]496]
transliteration: haraf hak andhar dhilash maavaa kunadh | 496 |
translation: Then, just one word of Akaalpurakh settles down in the depths of his heart. (496)

gurmukhi: ^wsqm qrqIib eIN du?r dwnw rw
transliteration: khaasatham tharatheeb ee dhur dhaanaa raa
translation: I have threaded these grains of pearls into a necklace,

gurmukhi: ik AwSnw swzd idil bygwnw rw ]497]
transliteration: k aashanaa saazadh dhil baegaanaa raa | 497 |
translation: So that this arrangement may make the ignorant hearts aware of the secrets of Waaheguru. (497)

gurmukhi: Awib hYvW pur Sudw cU jwim aU
transliteration: aab haivaa(n) pur shudhaa choo jaam oo
translation: (This compilation) Like a cup is filled to the brim with the divine elixir,

gurmukhi: izMdgI nwmw Sudw zW nwim aU ]498]
transliteration: zindhagee naamaa shudhaa zaa(n) naam oo | 498 |
translation: That is why, it has been given the name 'Zindagee Naamaa'. (498)

gurmukhi: kz qk?lum bUie ier&W AwiedS
transliteration: kaz thakalum booe eirafaa(n) aaeidhasha
translation: From his speeches emerges the fragrance of divine knowledge,

gurmukhi: vz idil Awlm igrwh ibkuSwiedS ]499]
transliteration: vaz dhil aalam giraah bikushaaeidhash | 499 |
translation: With it, the knot (mysteries and suspicions) of the heart of the world is untangled. (499)

gurmukhi: hr ik ^wnd Az rih luq&o krm
transliteration: har k khaanadh az rehi luthafo karama
translation: Whosoever recites this with the grace and compassion of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: grddS dr rwih ier&W muhqirm ]500]
transliteration: garadhadhash dhar raahi eirafaa(n) muhatharim | 500 |
translation: He receives laurels among the enlightened persons. (500)

gurmukhi: hsq izkir Awir&win pwk rw
transliteration: hasath zikar aarifaan paak raa
translation: This volume contains description and delineation of sacred and divine men;

gurmukhi: AwN ik aU rOSn kund iedrwk rw ]501]
transliteration: aa k oo raauashan kunadh eidharaak raa | 501 |
translation: This description lightens up the intelligence and the wisdom. (501)

gurmukhi: nIsq dr vY muMdrj AY bw-^br
transliteration: neesath dhar vai mundharaj ai baa-khabara
translation: O informed person! In this volume,

gurmukhi: ZYr hri& bMdgI hri& idgr ]502]
transliteration: ghair haraf bandhagee haraf dhigar | 502 |
translation: there is no other word or expression except the words or expressions of remembrance and meditation of  Akaalpuralkh. (502)

gurmukhi: Xwid h?k srmwXw-ie rOSn idlIsq
transliteration: yaadh hak saramaayaa-e raauashan dhileesatha
translation: Remembrance of Waaheguru is the treasure of the enlightened minds,

gurmukhi: ZYr Xwid h?k hmw by-hwslIAq ]503]
transliteration: ghair yaadh hak hamaa bae-haasaleeath | 503 |
translation: Everything else other than the meditation of Waaheguru is (absolutely) useless. (503)

gurmukhi: hri& dIgr nIsq ZYr Az Xwid h?k
transliteration: haraf dheegar neesath ghair az yaadh haka
translation: Do not read or even look at any word or expression except the ones about meditation of the Omnipotent,

gurmukhi: Xwid h?k hW Xwid h?k hW Xwid h?k ]504]
transliteration: yaadh hak haa(n) yaadh hak haa(n) yaadh hak | 504 |
translation: Remembrance of God, yes remembrance of God, and only remembrance of God. (504)

gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI hr idil pzmurdw rw
transliteration: yaa eilaahee har dhil pazamuradhaa raa
translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly make every withered and disheartened mind green and confident again,

gurmukhi: sbz kun hr ^wiqir A&surdw rw ]505]
transliteration: sabaz kun har khaathir afasuradhaa raa | 505 |
translation: And, refresh and rejuvenate every wilted and languishing mind. (505)

gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI XwvrI kun bMdw rw
transliteration: yaa eilaahee yaavaree kun bandhaa raa
translation: O Waaheguru! Kindly help this person, yours truly,

gurmukhi: sur^urU kun hr idil SrimMdw rw ]506]
transliteration: surakhuroo kun har dhil sharamindhaa raa | 506 |
translation: And, make every ashamed and timid person successful and triumphant. (506)

gurmukhi: dr idil goXw hvwie SOk b^S
transliteration: dhar dhil goyaa havaae shaauak bakhasha
translation: O Akaalpurakh! (Kindly) bless the heart of Goyaa with the yearning of love (for You),

gurmukhi: br zubwnS z?rw-ie Az zOk b^S ]507]
transliteration: bar zubaanash zaraa-e az zaauak bakhash | 507 |
translation: And, bestow upon the tongue of Goyaa just one particle of the fondness for Your love. (507)

gurmukhi: qwN n bwSd ivrid AW juz Xwid h?k
transliteration: thaa n baashadh viradh aaa(n) juz yaadh haka

translation: Both the ens (N's) in his name depict nurturer, nourisher ans neighborly (boons, support and benefactions); the middle A represents the Akaalpurakh, and the last K represents the Ultimate great prophet.
